The brand-new Mercedes-Benz A-Class (2018): Winter Test | Trailer
The brand-new Mercedes-Benz A-Class (2018) is finally there after more than four years of meticulous development work and testing. Now the new A-Class is completing its last extensive test drives in wintry Sweden. Testing in the climate tunnel is also a key aspect of the winter testing. These challenging testing cycles focus on the vehicle as a whole as well as the new engines. 

►Subscribe to the channel now:
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Did you know that the success story of the compact cars from Mercedes-Benz already began 20 years ago, with the launch of the first A-Class? More than 5,555,555 Mercedes-Benz compact cars have been delivered worldwide since March 1997 – of which three million alone were A-Class models.

One highlight of the optional Driving Assistance package in the Mercedes-Benz E-Class is the DRIVE PILOT system, the next step along the road to autonomous driving. As the Distance Pilot DISTRONIC on motorways and country roads, it is not only able to keep the car the correct distance behind vehicles in front automatically, it can also follow them at a speed of up to 210 km/h for the first time.

▶ http://mb4.me/The_NewE-Class

Mercedes-AMG GT: The GT Family at Bilster Berg Pt. 1 | #MBFanFilm
Race driver Jan Seyffarth invites „fünfkommasechs“ to a very special event: the Mercedes-AMG GT family reunion! From the original GT via GT S and GT C (Roadster) all the way up to the GT3 and GT4 customer race cars, presented to you by „Mister DTM“ Bernd Schneider. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz Arocs Performance Days: Off the road with MB Trucks | #MBreporter
The Mercedes-Benz Arocs is a highly specialised allrounder amongst heavy-duty construction vehicles. Follow Mercedes-Benz reporter Markus Haubold as he shows the strength of this vehicle and explains how it can handle even the most challenging situation so well. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

The new Arocs can powerfully master every driving situation. All the components of the drive system are produced exclusively at Mercedes-Benz and are designed for the special requirements in construction transport. The intelligent control of the drive components, the high torque of the engines plus the extremely short shift times of Mercedes PowerShift 3 ensure that there is more power available than was previously the case. For the best possible traction and good steerability the drive system, chassis, suspension and frame form a precisely coordinated working team which is optimally configured in all Arocs vehicles for the particular application in question on the road, on the construction site or in extreme terrain.

Mercedes-AMG Road Trip: from London to Affalterbach | #MBFanFilm
Celebrating the 50th year of the performance brand, a trio of AMG enthusiasts is taking three very special cars from England to Affalterbach, the Home of Driving Performance. Here, the three will meet fellow AMG fans and petrol heads i.e.the legendary engine builder Mike Kübler, with whom they are in constant contact on Instagram. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

The two-day drive takes the group from London to Folkstone, where the AMGs go to France by train. Near Reims, they set to explore the former Formula 1 racetrack “Circuit de Reims-Gueux”, before leaving for Affalterbach. For this special occasion, the three pick some of the coolest cars, from the Mercedes-AMG portfolio. They are the all new E 63 S 4MATIC+ Estate as well as two of the very exclusive Mercedes-AMG GT C Editon 50 Coupés. To capture the highlights of this big get-together, videographer Johannes Schlörb of fünfkommasechs accompanied the three on their journey.

Mercedes-AMG E 63 S 4MATIC+ Estate: 
Fuel consumption combined: 9.4–9.1 l/100km; 
combined CO₂ emissions: 214–206 g/km.*

Mercedes-AMG GT C: 
Fuel consumption combined: 11.4 l/100km; 
combined CO₂ emissions: 259 g/km.*

smart BRABUS forfour:

The new Mercedes-Benz GLA at North American International Auto Show: Fitness programme for the compact SUV.

The new GLA is starting the model year 2017 with an extended range of engines and targeted visual accentuation. Modified bumpers, additional light-alloy wheels and the new attractive colour “canyon beige” characterise the 2017 vintage at first glance. The GLA thus visually underlines its SUV genes to an even greater extent than before.

Wanna experience more? Head to http://mb4.me/GLA_f

#NAIAS

Mercedes-AMG is enhancing the GLA 45 4MATIC visually and technically, with an especially sporty host of equipment being offered by the Yellow Night Edition.

The characteristic distinguishing feature of the new Mercedes-AMG GLA 45 4MATIC is the sharpened front section. The front apron was given an even more dynamic shape, new air intake grilles, a front splitter insert in silver chrome plus flics in high-gloss black.

The special Yellow Night Edition is painted exclusively in night black or cosmos black and with its unique combination of matt graphite grey and yellow appliqué sections it is immediately identifiable. 

Get to know more: http://mb4.me/GLA45_f #NAIAS

Mercedes-Benz: Intelligent World Drive – Part 4: South Africa
Five continents within five month. Mercedes-Benz starts the “Intelligent World Drive”, the first automated test drive of a series-produced vehicle around the globe. Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.
The S-Class will collect Data in Europe, China, Australia, Africa and the United States to improve driver assistant system technology and adjust it to the various markets. In this episode Mercedes-Benz tests various traffic scenarios in Cape Town, South Africa.

Mercedes-AMG GLE 63 S 4MATIC Coupé: Black Forest Road Trip | #MBvideocar
[Mercedes-AMG GLE 63 S 4MATIC Coupé: Fuel consumption combined: 11.9 l/100 km; combined CO₂ emissions: 278 g/km.*] Mercedes-Benz presents another #MBvideocar episode. Videographer Florian Nick from Stuttgart headed for the German Black Forest to unleashes the beast that is the Mercedes-AMG GLE 63 S 4MATIC Coupé. The result is an incredible composition of human acrobatics and driving performance in its wildest manner.

► Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for the next episode here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

As another exciting interpretation of a four-door coupé, the commanding SUV meets the highest of standards in terms of performance, design and comfort. The powerful heart – the AMG 5.5-litre V8 biturbo engine – beats even faster in the new Mercedes-AMG GLE 63 Coupé: up to 430 kW (585 PS) are at your disposal in this car. The perfect prerequisites for a highly dynamic on-road driving experience come courtesy of the suspension, which has been systematically designed for a sporty performance. The high-performance SUV coupé comes with the AMG RIDE CONTROL sports suspension with active roll stabilisation ACTIVE CURVE SYSTEM and the Sports Direct-Steer system. The 4MATIC all-wheel drive with rear-biased power distribution and the DYNAMIC SELECT transmission modes promise to deliver what distinguishes every AMG vehicle: driving performance.

► Videographer: Florian Nick

Brake Test | Mercedes-Benz Genuine Parts vs. Fake Parts
Mercedes-Benz drivers expect “The best or nothing”. When it comes to safety, compromises are out of place. This test shows the comparison of Mercedes-Benz genuine brake pads with counterfeit brake parts. The results show that the latter cause a delayed braking effect and therefore a much longer stopping distance. Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz subjects all parts to extensive testing before they can call themselves Mercedes-Benz Genuine Parts. And we attach particular importance to functionality and durability. Mercedes-Benz Service and Genuine Parts. Simply reliable.

Mercedes-Benz Cars at the North American International Auto Show: World premiere of the new G-Class: the legend remains true to itself - Mercedes-Benz heads into 2018 with the relaunch of a classic. At the North American International Auto Show (NAIAS) in Detroit, the brand with the star will unveil the new G-Class. The off-road legend will undergo the biggest makeover in its history while at the same time remaining true to itself. Whether on- or off-road, the all-terrain vehicle impresses under all conditions with its performance, state-of-the-art assistance systems for safety and comfort, superb handling and a reinterpretation of its iconic design. Mercedes-Benz will present the vehicle at the traditional New Year's Reception on the eve of the first press day.

Joyful Anticipation: The pinnacle of anticipation (Bremen plant)
The big finish – the pinnacle of anticipation: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Joyful Anticipation", private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Don’t miss any episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV. | Episode 1 of the series “Joyful Anticipation” in the Mercedes-Benz plant Bremen: https://youtu.be/ifUinSiRJwM

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0ORtgsuktflZkFR0ofRglHrNuOC2Xuq5

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time by logging in to http://mercedes.me/production. 

In the Finishing section, the fourth part of the video series, the final quality tests are carried out before the vehicle leaves the plant and is handed over to the customer polished to a high gloss. 

“Joyful Anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, E-Class, S-Class, CLA, CLS, GLA, GLC, SL and SLC.

Mercedes-Benz Service and Genuine Parts | “Almost”
Mercedes-Benz drivers expect “The best or nothing”. When it comes to safety, compromises are out of place. “Almost” the best service and “almost” a genuine part are just not good enough. Because: Almost gets you nowhere. Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz subjects all parts to extensive testing before they can call themselves Mercedes-Benz Genuine Parts. And we attach particular importance to functionality and durability. Mercedes-Benz Service and Genuine Parts. Simply reliable.

Future Traditions: A Christmas film by Mercedes-Benz (Swabian) | TV Spot
Driving home for Christmas this year? In other words, are you all set for a spot of tuneless carol-singing with the family, last-minute present-buying stress and enough chocolate to sink a ship? Yes, Christmas traditions can be quite challenging. But look outside and you’ll see that our world is spinning faster than ever, so isn’t it nice to know that some things stay the same? Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz and EQ show Christmas isn’t the only thing just around the corner. The future is too – with a fascinating vision in which all-electric, autonomously driving EQ models, Volocopters and drones prove that, together, we can change some things for the better. Some people can’t get enough of Christmas. Others can. But Mercedes-Benz and EQ still wish you Happy Holidays. Also in the future. #futuretraditions

Future traditions: A Christmas film by Mercedes-Benz | TV-Spot
Driving home for Christmas this year? In other words, are you all set for a spot of tuneless carol-singing with the family, last-minute present-buying stress and enough chocolate to sink a ship? Yes, Christmas traditions can be quite challenging. But look outside and you’ll see that our world is spinning faster than ever, so isn’t it nice to know that some things stay the same? Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz and EQ show Christmas isn’t the only thing just around the corner. The future is too – with a fascinating vision in which all-electric, autonomously driving EQ models, Volocopters and drones prove that, together, we can change some things for the better. Some people can’t get enough of Christmas. Others can. But Mercedes-Benz and EQ still wish you Happy Holidays. Also in the future. #futuretraditions

Mercedes-AMG GLA 45 4MATIC: Frankfurt & Brouwersdam | #MBvideocar
[Mercedes-AMG GLA 45 4 MATIC: Fuel consumption combined: 7.4 l/100 km; combined CO₂ emissions: 172 g/km.*] Mercedes-Benz presents another #MBvideocar episode. Photographer Florian Haizmann worked as a filmmaker for the first time. Turned out that he is also talented in assembling moving images with this beautiful Mercedes-AMG GLA 45.

► Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for the next episode here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

With intelligent aerodynamic measures like the restyled front apron and the spoiler lip on the roof spoiler it was possible to increase driving dynamics and driving stability, yet wind resistance was simultaneously reduced. The characteristic distinguishing feature of the Mercedes-AMG GLA 45 4MATIC is the sharpened front section. The front apron was given an even more dynamic shape, new air intake grilles, a front splitter insert in silver chrome plus flics in high-gloss black.

Mercedes-Benz presents the #MBvideocar series: A project where #MBsocialcar videographers and film makers have the opportunity to carry out their own ideas. Mercedes-Benz supports the production of these episodes financially but also by providing vehicles. The artists get to determine the staging, the model and the location. The result are unique episodes that are being published frequently on the official social media channels of Mercedes-Benz like YouTube and Facebook. If you too have an idea for a video, please apply now at info@mbsocialcar.de!

Joyful Anticipation: From individual parts to the complete work of art (Bremen plant)
Perfection – from individual parts to the complete work of art: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, “Joyful Anticipation”, private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Don’t miss an episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Episode 4 of the series “Joyful Anticipation” in the Mercedes-Benz plant Bremen: https://youtu.be/2CLnU_Rl7Pc

► Watch all episodes here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0ORtgsuktflZkFR0ofRglHrNuOC2Xuq5

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time by logging in to http://mercedes.me/production.

In assembly, the third part of the film series, the individual vehicle components are put together. The car is born. One of the many highlights is the so-called marriage: putting together the body shell and the drive train. 

“Joyful Anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, E-Class, S-Class, CLA, CLS, GLA, GLC, SL and SLC.

Mercedes-Benz Marco Polo HORIZON EDITION: Stylish Adventurer
Versatile, sporty, stylish: The Marco Polo HORIZON EDITION* is the youngest member of the Marco Polo family and boasts a dynamic exterior and sophisticated interior design. It is equipped with a variable rail system in the rear to convince both in everyday life and on adventure trips. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

V 250 d 4MATIC:
Fuel consumption combined: 6.7 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 177 g/km.**

In addition to the 3-seater bench, two additional seats can be easily fitted and removed. The COMAND Online digital control unit, the mechanical pop-up roof and the rear window, which can be separately opened, make the Marco Polo HORIZON EDITION the perfect partner for big and small adventures.

Mercedes-Benz Marco Polo: A Luxurious Camper Van
You don’t want to forego comfort and a sophisticated design when camping? Then you have found your future travel companion in the Mercedes-Benz Marco Polo. The interior of the comfortable camper van offers luxurious and top-class equipment. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

Marco Polo 250 d:
Fuel consumption combined: 6.2 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 164 g/km.*

The integrated kitchen, including a gas hob with two burners, a compressor cooler and a sink, as well as the fold-out table invite you to linger. In addition, the electric pop-up roof with double bed and the two-seater luxury bench with bed extension offer sleeping accommodation for up to four people. In the front of the vehicle, the Marco Polo boasts the COMAND Online multimedia system and a wide range of assistance systems. So you are prepared for any adventure.

Mercedes-Benz Marco Polo ACTIVITY: A Flexible Leisure Vehicle
With the Mercedes-Benz Marco Polo ACTIVITY, nothing stands in the way of a spontaneous weekend trip. Inside the flexible leisure vehicle there are swivel front seats, sleeping accommodation for up to five people and a foldable convenient table with practical bottle and cup holders. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

The Mercedes-Benz Marco Polo ACTIVITY utilizes the Vito chassis. The gently rising structure line that runs from above the front wheel arch back to the rear is a characteristic element of the vehicle’s side design. The functional rear section provides plenty of space, allowing the Marco Polo to effortlessly transport luggage and large objects. The Marco Polo ACTIVITY features robust front and rear bumpers made of grained, anthracite plastic. Diverse options allow the exterior to be customized as desired. 

Discover the Marco Polo ACTIVITY together with Yasmine Blair – your comfortable retreat for the next adventure.

Mercedes-Benz DISTRONIC: A Smarter Way to Hack Traffic | Veritasium Episode #5
What if there was a way to reduce your agitation when navigating your way through traffic? Watch in this episode the perks of an advanced driver assistance system. The “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series is here to show you the latest in auto innovation with the S-Class. For more interesting videos subscribe here: https://www.youtube.com/user/MercedesBenzTV

Cruise control in a car makes for an easy and relaxed driving experience but there is always the fear of the driver’s attention span waning slightly. The Mercedes cars with adaptive cruise control provide extra security when it comes to maintaining a safe distance from the vehicle ahead and adapting to the relevant speed limits.
Activated via the usual cruise control system, Mercedes-Benz Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC detects the changing pace of the traffic in front and adapts your speed – by either accelerating or gently applying the brakes – appropriately. By means of an advanced radar sensor and an in-system microcomputer, the dynamic cruise control can detect any approaching traffic within a 150-metre distance.  
The cruise control system uses innovative, safe distance technology to assist with your journey. Not only does Mercedes cruise control provide an intuitive assistant system for all in-traffic situations, but it also reminds you with both visual and sound signals to act when needed. 
Mercedes-Benz Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC in the new S-Class, when combined with other features such as Active Lane Keeping Assist, Active Blind Spot Assist and Active Brake Assist with cross-traffic function, can provide for an effortless journey, safely assisting you from one place to the next.

Find out more about the Mercedes-Benz Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC here:
http://techcenter.mercedes-benz.com/en/distronic/detail.html

Exploring the latest in technology and engineering, Veritasium brings you exciting demos, interviews, experiments and discussions in the world of science. As part of the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series, we present five episodes exploring Mercedes’ latest innovations in the automotive industry. To find out more about intelligent driving and features such as an adaptive cruise control that automatically accelerates and decelerates accordingly in traffic, or a pre-collision system that is activated to help keep passengers safe, then watch the full series here.

Mercedes-Benz passes two million mark of vehicles sold to date in 2017 - Mercedes-Benz delivered 195,698 vehicles to its customers in November (+7.2%), thus achieving the 57th record month in succession. In the first eleven months of the year, 2,095,810 units were sold. This represents not only the best-ever figure for the period of January to November, but also a growth of 10.7% in unit sales. Last month, Mercedes-Benz was the premium brand with the most new registrations in markets including Germany, France, Italy, Austria, Portugal, Taiwan, USA, Canada, and Mexico.

“Mercedes-Benz passed the two-million mark in November, already surpassing its unit sales for the entire previous year. We are going full speed ahead for our customers – not only with the best products, but also in sales and service. And this has already been rewarded with the most successful sales year in our history,” stated Britta Seeger, Member of the Board of Management of Daimler AG responsible for Mercedes-Benz Cars Marketing & Sales.

Journey North: A Canadian G-Class Road Trip
Photographer Alen Palander and some friends took two Mercedes-Benz G 550 on a journey along the beautiful West Coast of Canada. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz G 500:
Fuel consumption combined: 12.3 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 289 g/km.*

The trip led the group from Vancouver all the way up to Whitehorse – an absolutely unique road experience with highlights on and off the rough northern highways.

The success story of Mercedes-Benz's classic off-roader spans more than 35 years. With its continuously improved technology and high-class equipment specification, the G-Class off-roader is a true icon. Visually, the Mercedes-Benz G-Class SUV stands out with a distinctive design and eye-catching looks – from the outside as well as from the inside. 

What characterizes the Mercedes-Benz G-Class is the sturdy basis of body and ladder-type frame, which still offers generous reserves to cope with the increased power. The unrivalled off-road performance with permanent all-wheel drive, low-range gearbox and three differential locks that can be engaged/disengaged while on the move also define the G-Class offroad vehicle.

Exclusive Making-of: DC Comics, Cars & Justice League Super Heroes
Comic artists and car designers have more in common than you think: when dreams come true. Watch the creation of a unique project!
Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

The global marketing campaign of Mercedes-Benz for the film “Justice League” started on 6 October – before the German cinema start on 16 November 2017 – with the release of the TV spot, in which all the movie vehicles can be seen. A “Making-of” featurette provides film and comic fans with an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at the film shoot, highlighting the main Mercedes-Benz vehicles and the tremendous effort that was necessary in order to build up the Mercedes-Benz AMG Vision Gran Turismo new interior for its big screen debut. A leading element of a multi-faceted social media blast promoting the movie and its hero vehicles is a series of digital comic stories that have been created in close co-operation with DC’s Custom Creative Studio, which have been released exclusively on Mercedes-Benz’ Instagram channels. These stories focus on the private lives of the “Justice League” characters’ alter egos, and present a fresh take on how a cool vehicle can sometimes save the day—even for the world’s most powerful heroes.

Super Heroes now drive Mercedes-Benz!

Mercedes me Adapter: Search for a Parking Space
People are always searching for something. We search for excitement, quiet, contact, safety and often for parking. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

With automatic location memory and many other features the Mercedes me Adapter can help finding the right parking space. The Mercedes me Adapter links your vehicle very simply with your smartphone via Bluetooth®, allowing you to experience the dialogue with your vehicle in a totally new way.

You can automatically record the routes you drove or the refueling stops you made on your smartphone, quickly and easily locate your parked vehicle and always keep an eye on current vehicle data such as odometer reading and tank fill level. At any time and conveniently with the Mercedes me Adapter app. Benefit from our individual Maintenance Management and receive suitable offers for your service appointment from your Mercedes-Benz Service partner. In the case of a breakdown or accident, prompt and effective help is provided by the appropriate checklists, direct contact with customer support and the relaying of the vehicle data as well as (depending on your smartphone settings) your current position. At the same time, you have access to a host of offers, services and information from the world of Mercedes me.

The Mercedes me Adapter is inserted into the diagnostics interface (the so-called “OBD2 connector”) of your vehicle. This interface allows the Mercedes me Adapter to read vehicle data and send them to your personal smartphone via Bluetooth®. This gives you the possibility to access these data with the Mercedes me Adapter app and use all functionalities. You access your personalized world of Mercedes-Benz through the Mercedes me portal.

Mercedes-Benz CLS (2018): Pioneer of a New Design Idiom | Gorden Wagener
The new Mercedes-Benz CLS (2018) pioneers the new design idiom of Mercedes-Benz, which is recognisable by its clear contours and reduced lines. Gorden Wagener – Chief Design Officer Daimler AG – shares insights into the design language of the third generation CLS. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV. 

In 2004, with the CLS, Mercedes-Benz created a new vehicle segment that for the first time combined the elegance and dynamism of a coupé with the comfort and functionality of a saloon. With the third generation of the CLS, Mercedes-Benz is now building more strongly than ever on the aura and unique character of this trendsetting model: the new model has pure CLS genes with its arching waistline, flat side window lines and low greenhouse. At the same time it is another example of the logical evolution of the Sensual Purity design idiom: sharp edges and lines have been significantly reduced. It blends seamlessly into the current Mercedes-Benz coupé family with numerous design features. Its cd value of 0.26 is positive proof of outstanding aerodynamics.

content:
Mercedes-Benz reveals the new CLS | LA Auto Show 2017
The brand-new Mercedes-Benz CLS was presented at the L.A. Auto Show 2017. Like its predecessors, the new Mercedes-Benz CLS exudes self-assured sportiness in exemplary style. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

The new Mercedes-Benz CLS generation has many things in common with the new S‑Class, the automotive flagship of the entire industry: the CLS is equipped with the latest generation of driving assistance systems, with route-based driver support provided by the Driving Assistance Package. Active Distance Control DISTRONIC and Active Steering Assist now provide even more comfortable support for the driver to keep a safe distance and steer. The speed is now adjusted automatically ahead of bends or junctions.

The standard appointments of the CLS are as usual very extensive: the highlights include LED High Performance headlamps, 18-inch light-alloy wheels with mixed tyres, Lane Keeping Assist, Speed Limit Assist, a 12.3-inch media display, ambience lighting including illuminated air vents, Mercedes me connect services and a communication module with LTE.

How to remote park your Mercedes-Benz via your phone | Veritasium Episode #4
Want to feel like a kid playing with an RC car again? With Mercedes-Benz you can park your car from a distance using your smartphone. Discover more advanced car features in the Mercedes-Benz meets Veritasium series with the new S-Class. Subscribe here to see the next episode: https://www.youtube.com/user/MercedesBenzTV

This Remote Parking Assist video shows the remote parking app in action at the Mercedes-Benz SimCity simulated parking lot with the new S-Class. As soon as the car measures and determines the free parking spaces, the driver selects a suitable space and exits the car. Next, the driver activates the remote parking app, and guides the car into the space. The car’s parking assist sensors react to obstacles or objects in its path. To ensure the utmost safety and security, a continuous confirmation action is required in order to use the parking assist system via the user’s smartphone.

The Mercedes-Benz parking assist is designed for urban areas, where parking can prove difficult. Allow parking assist to take care of potentially stressful situations for you. Whether it’s a tight space or simply a reduced-mobility situation, manoeuvring your vehicle couldn’t be easier with Mercedes Parking Assist.

►Find out more about the Mercedes-Benz Remote Parking Assist here:
http://techcenter.mercedes-benz.com/en/remote-parking-pilot/detail.html

Exploring the latest in technology and engineering, Veritasium brings you exciting demos, interviews, experiments and discussions in the world of science. As part of the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series, we present five episodes exploring Mercedes’ latest innovations in the automotive industry. To find out more about intelligent driving and features such as an adaptive cruise control that automatically accelerates and decelerates accordingly in traffic, or a pre-collision system that is activated to help keep passengers safe, then watch the full series here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0ORtgsuktfnC6wJ5PWN9xnbjJeigXPJI

A South Pacific Island Road Trip | Mercedes-Benz B-Class | Vagabrothers
When we talk about explorers and adventure we may think of discovering new places and things no one has ever seen before, claiming unchartered territory and being confronted with challenging new circumstances and characters. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

But in a time when there is not much left to discover, what if the real adventure is to find similarities – what connects us rather than what sets us apart? No matter how far we go – if we look closely, we will always find something that originates closer to home than expected and that makes an exotic place not that foreign at all. 

A while ago we collaborated with California based travel vloggers Marko and Alex Ayling, better known as the Vagabrothers to the YouTube community, to explore how travelling has changed. We picked a place that is off the beaten track so to speak, surrounded by water but is known for its rich biodiversity, ever changing landscape and a population that is as diverse as its history is fascinating. 

Watch the Vagabrothers as they embark on a four-day roadtrip with a Mercedes-Benz B-Class, leaving numerous clues about this remote place, which is simply stunning. Watch the vlog on their channel first or – spoiler alert – go straight to the revealing of the mystery location in the short film above.

In collaboration with the Vagabrothers: 
Marko and Alex Ayling
Directed & produced by Hadassa Haack
Director of Photography Jon Shaw / ginclearfilm

Mercedes-AMG C 63 S Coupé: Road Trip in Norway | #MBvideocar
[Mercedes-AMG C 63 S Coupé: Fuel consumption combined: 8.9–8.6 l/100 km; combined CO₂ emissions: 209–200 g/km.*] Mercedes-Benz presents another #MBvideocar episode. This time German video producer Simon von Broich once more went on an adventure with the Mercedes-AMG C 63 S Coupé and discovered some epic scenery all the way up north in Norway. 

► Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for the next episode here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

The Mercedes-AMG C 63 Coupé is the next step on the way to yet more technical and visual distinction. The far-reaching technical modifications are evident at first sight: strikingly flared front and rear wheel arches, an increased track width and larger wheels give the Coupé a muscular look while at the same time providing a basis for the highly agile longitudinal and lateral dynamics.

The brand-new Mercedes-Benz CLS (2018) | Teaser | Exterior Design
Be prepared for the brand-new Mercedes-Benz CLS (2018): In 2003, with the CLS, Mercedes-Benz created a new vehicle segment that for the first time combined the elegance and dynamism of a coupé with the comfort and functionality of a saloon. With the third generation of the CLS, Mercedes-Benz is now building more strongly than ever on the aura and unique character of this trendsetting model.

► Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here:
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

What defines the Mercedes-Benz CLS is a clear yet emotional and sporty design along with innovative engineering. The CLS is a visual treat with its modern, dynamic design that at the same time exudes sensual purity, arouses emotions and, to top it all off, presents high-tech in perfect fashion. With straightforward sportiness, thrilling flowing lines and high-grade materials on the level of a luxury vehicle, the ambience of the Mercedes-Benz CLS is modern, luxurious and at the same time sporty. The Mercedes-Benz CLS certainly places great emphasis on exclusivity and functionality.

Can Mercedes-Benz Evasive Steering Assist help prevent an accident? | Veritasium Episode #3
We can all feel under pressure when driving; in an emergency situation, imagine a car that can assist a mind caught off guard to steer out of harm's way. Find out more about such intelligent driving features on the Mercedes-Benz meets Veritasium series and subscribe here for more: 
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

In the event of a potential collision with either a passenger crossing the road or standing in the road in front of you, the Mercedes-Benz Evasive Steering Assist system in the new S-Class helps you avoid a collision. During an emergency situation, all the driver’s force is applied to braking full pressure and not enough force, or attention, remains to steer. The Mercedes power assisted steering system detects that the driver no longer requires braking, but rather car steering. It therefore releases the brakes and provides the driver with extra torque upon steering in order to help the driver evade the pedestrian. The amount of torque applied is precisely calculated by the collision avoidance system itself. As soon as the collision has been avoided, the steering system assists with straightening up once again.
The driver assist system is able to detect pedestrians by their shape, their size, their radar reflectivity, and most importantly the movement of their legs. Both the radar and the camera can detect the moving legs of a pedestrian's body and therefore distinguish that it’s a relevant object to be avoided. 
The complete Mercedes driver assistance package helps the driver avoid collisions by means of both a radar and a camera, helping to keep both passengers and pedestrians safe inside and out. 

Find out more about the Mercedes-Benz Evasive Steering Assist here:
http://techcenter.mercedes-benz.com/en/steering-pilot/detail.html 

Exploring the latest of technology and engineering, Veritasium brings you exciting demos, interviews, experiments and discussions in the world of science. As part of the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series, we present five episodes exploring Mercedes’ latest innovations in the automotive industry. To find out more about intelligent driving and features such as an adaptive cruise control that automatically accelerates and decelerates accordingly in traffic, or a pre-collision system that is activated to help keep passengers safe, then watch the full series.

Road Trip on the Algarve Coast: Mercedes-Benz GLE & Branko | My Guide Portugal
Branko takes the Mercedes-Benz GLE on a road trip down the Algarve Coast to discover the most beautiful spots in Portugal with My Guide and AVIS. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Branko – born João Barbosa – is an established name in Lisbon’s music scene. Usually scouring the world for new influences, the trip to the Algarve becomes a journey to his roots. Driving the Mercedes-Benz GLE 350 d 4MATIC, the premium SUV of Mercedes-Benz, he shows us five of his favorite places on the Portuguese coast: Monte da Lameira distillery, “Praio do Monte Clérigo” beach, the little harbor town of Calheta, the “Barragem da Bravura” reservoir, a little fishing village called Burgau, Cape “Cabo de Sao Vincente”.

With My Guide and Avis’ travel planner there’s nothing stopping you from taking a trip along the Algarve coast. Countless features facilitate individual travel planning; compilation of personal lists with travel planner, curated travel guides for select cities and regions, as well as the ability to download routes directly into the car’s GPS make planning your journey of discovery easier than ever.

The EQ Ready App. Are you ready for e-mobility?  The EQ Ready App from Mercedes-Benz analyses individual driving behaviour. How does it work? It is very smart: download, activate the tracking function and drive. The app automatically records your journeys. EQ Ready analyses the daily driving behaviour and compares this with parameters of electric and hybrid vehicles. The result: you can receive a simple and compact report about whether you could now manage your daily driving routines with an electric vehicle.  Find out more here: http://mb4.me/EQ_readyapp

Freediver & Spearfisher Kimi Werner: Finding Your Own Place | She’s Mercedes
Kimi Werner is a professional freediver and one of the most decorated spearfishers in the world. She has dived all five of the planet’s oceans and is able to dive deeper than 150 feet on a single breath – which she is able to hold for almost five minutes. For “She’s Mercedes”, the former U.S. national spearfishing champion unveiled the process of following her own expectations in a world of competitions and expectations. Find out how the Hawaiian local hero of freediving managed to find that sense of belonging she has been missing for so long – one that she could only find within herself. Kimi Werner is taking the joyride in a Mercedes-Benz GLC Coupé.

The BAMBI Awards, Germany's most famous media awards, were yesterday staged for the 69th time at the Berlin Stage Theater on Potsdam Square. Prominent guests chauffeured to the red carpet in Mercedes-Benz saloons included Claudia Schiffer, Diane Kruger, Fatih Akin, Hugh Jackman, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Ai Weiwei, Moritz Bleibtreu, Die Lochis, Stefanie Giesinger, Felix Jaehn, Palina Rojinski, Sarah Brandner, Franziska Knuppe and many more. Mercedes-Benz's involvement at the exclusive evening gala this year was much influenced by the blockbuster movie JUSTICE LEAGUE, which celebrated its German cinema premiere yesterday. The film features several Mercedes-Benz vehicles in spectacular roles. Two of the original vehicles from the film were positioned as eye-catchers at the BAMBI Awards: the Mercedes-Benz AMG Vision Gran Turismo and the new E-Class Cabriolet.

Can Mercedes-Benz Active Brake Assist help prevent collisions? | Veritasium Episode #2
The emergency brake assist in the new Mercedes-Benz S-Class (2017) can help the driver to avoid a collision when inattentive. In the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” video series you can watch the latest in auto innovation. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for the next episode here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

When it comes to car safety features, the collision avoidance system provides the peace of mind that every driver is searching for. The cross-traffic function can detect approaching intersecting vehicles and persons with the help of a long-range radar used in conjunction with a stereo camera. 

How does the Active Brake Assist work?
In an emergency situation, the Active Brake Assist warns the driver of the oncoming danger and, depending on the distance and size of the obstacle ahead, sends out an acoustic or visual warning to alert the driver. If the driver reacts in time, the emergency brake assist supports the driver in applying pressure to the brakes, and if the driver reacts too slowly, the automatic braking system will be activated.

The Active Brake Assist automatic braking system can be activated and deactivated as and when the driver pleases. Additionally, it can be set to one of three modes including “Early”, “Medium” and “Late” mode – each of which determines the sensitivity of the driver assist programme. 

By interpreting your driving behaviour, Active Brake Assist provides an intuitive safety measure that will bring your vehicle to a halt or reduce the speed exactly when you need it most. Active Brake Assist is just one of the many Mercedes driver assist features created to provide you with the ultimate security in all your driving endeavours.

► Find out more about the Active Brake Assist here:
http://techcenter.mercedes-benz.com/en/active-braking-assist-2016/detail.html

Who is Veritasium?
Exploring the best of technology and engineering, Veritasium brings you exciting demos, interviews, experiments and discussions in the world of science. As part of the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series, we present five episodes exploring Mercedes-Benz’s latest innovations in the automotive industry. To find out more about Mercedes-Benz Intelligent Drive and features such as an adaptive cruise control that automatically accelerates and decelerates accordingly in traffic, or a pre-collision system that is activated to help keep passengers safe, then watch the full series here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0ORtgsuktfnC6wJ5PWN9xnbjJeigXPJI

International brand cooperation between Mercedes-Benz and Emirates Airline: Fly Emirates’ First Class – inspired by Mercedes-Benz - Mercedes-Benz and Emirates Airline are joining forces as part of a brand cooperation move. The first project is the completely redesigned First Class in the Boeing 777 fleet belonging to Emirates. Inspired by the interior design of the S?Class, it sets new standards in the aviation industry in terms of luxury and comfort. As a result, Emirates and Mercedes-Benz are leading the way with luxurious first-class mobility both on land and in the air. This is underscored by an exclusive S?Class Chauffeur-drive service. From 1 December 2017, passengers flying in the new First Class cabins can make use of new S?Class models for door-to-door transfer to and from Dubai airport.

Mercedes-Benz Ex-Factory Driving Aids for People with Disabilities
Mercedes-Benz Ex-Factory Driving Aids allow people with disabilities to enjoy automotive independence. The film shows a C 350 e equipped with factory installed driving aids including a hand control unit, a steering wheel knob, an entrance guard and a pedal cover. These features are available for nearly every Mercedes-Benz model and enable people with a handicap to drive their vehicle of choice without compromising comfort. 

2:03 – Ex-Factory Driving Aids
2:11 – Steering Wheel Knob
3:09 – Hand Control Unit “Classic”
4:39 – Entrance Guard

Some of the features shown may not be available in all countries.

C 350 e Estate:
Fuel consumption combined: 2.4–2.1 l/100 km; 
combined CO₂ emissions: 55–49 g/km; 
power consumption weighted: 13.8–11.7 kWh/100 km.*

Mercedes-Benz PRE-SAFE®: Can You Protect Yourself Before A Car Accident? | Veritasium Episode 1
How can a vehicle help prepare a driver and passengers for an accident just moments before it happens? Buckle up – the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series is here to show you the latest in auto innovation. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for the next episode here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

The Mercedes-Benz PRE-SAFE® system is used in conjunction with both the Mercedes-Benz Active Brake Assist and the Electronic Stability Programme ESP®, both of which are car safety features that detect dangerous situations via advanced sensors.

As soon as certain hazardous conditions are detected, PRE-SAFE® activates a number of safety features. These include electrical reversible belt tensioners, the PRE-SAFE® seat positioning function, and the automatic closing of windows and the sunroof. The PRE-SAFE® seatbelt element ensures that both the driver and the front passenger are fixed in their seats while the positioning function places the passenger in a more favourable position for a potential collision. In the new Mercedes-Benz S-Class, those features are even available as an option for the outboard rear seats.

The Mercedes-Benz PRE-SAFE® system utilizes sensing technology of active safety systems in order to identify situations that could end in a crash. However, if the crash can be avoided, the preventive measures will be deactivated, leaving you ready to continue your ride.
 
Exploring the best of technology and engineering, Veritasium brings you exciting demos, interviews, experiments and discussions in the world of science: https://www.youtube.com/user/1veritasium

As part of the “Veritasium meets Mercedes-Benz” series, we present five episodes exploring Mercedes-Benz’s latest innovations in the automotive industry. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for the next episode here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

Mercedes-Benz begins fourth quarter with new sales record - Mercedes-Benz continued its record sales series last month with another best-ever figure of 182,812 vehicles sold in an October (+5.6%). As a result, the number of vehicles sold in the first ten months of the year increased to a new high of 1,900,112 representing growth of 11.1% compared with the same period of last year. In October, Mercedes-Benz was the premium brand with the most new registrations in several markets including Germany, Italy, Spain, Belgium, Austria, Portugal, Taiwan, the USA and Canada.

“In China, more customers have already been delighted to receive their new Mercedes-Benz than in the whole of last year. And sales were strong not only there: Worldwide, we increased our unit sales by a double-digit rate in the first ten months of the year,” stated Britta Seeger, Member of the Board of Management of Daimler AG responsible for Mercedes-Benz Cars Marketing & Sales.

The exclusive special models are now available for ordering and will reach showrooms in January 2018.

The company is one of the main sponsors, emphasizing the relevance of the digital transformation. Mercedes-Benz is also presenting itself as an attractive employer for digital talents, and organising co-creations with startups and established players. More than 60,000 visitors from over 160 countries are expected to attend the world's largest & most important tech conference in the Portuguese capital from November 6 - 9th.

On the road to autonomous driving: Second leg of the 'Intelligent World Drive’ - Mercedes-Benz on automated test drive in the Shanghai megalopolis - Urban traffic is one of the biggest challenges on the road to autonomous driving. Automated driving functions must be able to master highly complex traffic situations, which can differ greatly around the world. The focus of the test drives in Shanghai is on assessing the driving behaviour in extremely heavy traffic, as well as on infrastructure peculiarities. The test vehicle will face different traffic situations on five continents until January 2018 and will also gauge the limits of current systems in the process. The aim is to gather global insights in real-life traffic for the advancement of the technologies.

The Mercedes-AMG GT family continues to grow. With the Mercedes-AMG GT Concept, the performance brand offers an advance view of its four-door sports car at the Geneva Motor Show.

The A-Class from Mercedes-Benz celebrates its 20-year anniversary this month. On 18 October 1997 in Rastatt, a customer took possession of one for the very first time. More than three million others followed. As a result, the model not only established the segment of compact cars at Mercedes-Benz, but also began a real success story. Since then, more than 5,555,555 customers chose to buy an A-Class, B-Class, CLA, CLA Shooting Brake or GLA. While the first generations were popular with buyers mainly due to their functionality, the new generation of the family of compact cars launched in 2011 impressed above all with its sporty design. This played a significant role in changing the image of Mercedes-Benz. The buyers of a compact car from the Stuttgart-based brand bearing the three-pointed star have become younger.

The @mercedesamg GT family continues to grow. With the Mercedes-AMG GT Concept, the performance brand offers an advance view of its four-door sports car at the Geneva Motor Show.

New engine, additional models & even more equipment for the E-Class Coupé & Cabriolet! 
[Csn 6.8-6.7l/100km|CO?154-… https://t.co/k3pdtUwnuP

A newly developed four-cylinder petrol engine boasting the performance of a high-capacity six-cylinder engine yet with significantly reduced fuel consumption is set to celebrate its world premiere in the E?Class Coupé and Cabriolet. The engine generates 220 kW/299 hp from a displacement of 1991 cc and in the E 350 Coupé achieves a fuel consumption (combined) of 6.7 l/100 km (combined CO2emissions: 149 g/km), while in the E 350 Cabriolet its fuel consumption (combined) is 6.8 l/100 km (combined CO2 emissions: 154 g/km). Pioneering technologies such as the EQ-Boost starter-Generator, 48 volt on-board electrical system and a particulate filter for petrol engines contribute to enhanced environmental compatibility.

Watch the exclusive making-of “Geostorm” with comments from the film crew about the action-packed car scenes. Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

In the not-so-distant future, a satellite system will take control of global weather. However, the security provided by the system is not long-lasting. Two fully electric cars – the Mercedes-Benz B-Class Electric Drive and the smart fortwo electric drive – play an integral role in the disaster film “Geostorm” and overcome never before seen dangers. 60 minutes with X in Berlin: Highlights with Tim Bendzko, Savas and Sido | Mercedes-Benz X-Class
“60 minutes with X” – the unique chance to experience the new Mercedes-Benz X-Class before everyone else – premiered on 20 October in Berlin. More than 700 exclusive guests, a one-of-a-kind setup and a breathtaking location created a memorable night and impressive launch. For the very first time the German rappers Savas & Sido played songs from their new hit album and performed a show exclusively for “60 minutes with X”. Another highlight of the night: Singer Tim Bendzko joined the show as a secret act. Next stop for “60 minutes with X”: 30 October in Paris.

content:
Mercedes-AMG C 63 S Estate: Island Cruise on Corsica | #MBvideocar
[Mercedes-AMG C 63 S Estate: Fuel consumption combined: 8.4 l/100 km; combined CO₂ emissions: 196 g/km.*] Mercedes-Benz presents another #MBvideocar episode. This time Daniel Wagner and Benyamin Senkal are taking the Mercedes-AMG C 63 S Estate for a spin on the beautiful island of Corsica.

Striking shoulders. A vital, sporty aura. A clear, defined rear. And captivating styling. The new C-Class Estate is one thing above all: spacious in every respect, having become noticeably bigger. The organic design idiom differs markedly from that of its predecessor. The varied interplay between lines and edges as well as convex and concave surfaces creates vibrant and exciting contrasts across the entire vehicle.

Mercedes-AMG, too, has updated its S?Class Coupés and Cabriolets with a host of technical and visual highlights. As members of the large and successful S?Class family, the Coupé and Cabriolet benefit from the same extensive innovations that were only recently introduced on the Saloon. Follow the X-Class | Mercedes-Benz TV-Spot (2017)
Wherever the Mercedes-Benz X-Class appears – from the roughest desert to the most stylish urban setting – everyone becomes a follower. Can you follow the new X-Class? Subscribe to the channel so you get notified for new exciting videos here: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

The Mercedes-Benz X-Class unites the typical traits of a pickup – robustness, functionality, strength and off-road capabilities – with the classical characteristics of a real Mercedes-Benz: design, comfort, driving dynamics and safety. The new X-Class will be available in three variants: the PURE basic variant for classic robust use, PROGRESSIVE for higher requirements in terms of quality feel and comfort, and POWER as the high-end variant for urban lifestyles.

Mercedes-AMG: Milestones – Episode 8: 2016
Mercedes-AMG stands for high-performance vehicles made in Germany. Founded in 1967 in Großaspach as AMG, the company has ever since gained great success in developing some of the best motorsport vehicles in the world. In 2016, the Mercedes-AMG GT3 reached the first four places at the ADAC Zurich 24h race on the Nürburgring. Furthermore, the Mercedes-AMG Petronas F1 Team took the Constructors' World Championship title for the third time in succession, whilst Nico Rosberg became Drivers' World Champion and Lewis Hamilton Vice World Champion.

Mercedes-Benz presents: King of the City Jungle
How to tame a lion: the new S-Class with ENERGIZING comfort control. In the animal kingdom, he is undisputedly at the top of the food chain – there is no living creature that does not fear him: the lion. But even the strongest alpha animal has a bad day, as the new S-Class film by antoni proves in a very humorous way. In the spot for the new S-Class, it serves as a metaphor for the alpha animal in the business world: the boss of a successful startup. His day is anything but successful. Time and again, minor mishaps cause his mood to deteriorate. Stressed and anything but in a good mood, he gets into the new S-Class at the end of a long business day. Here, he experiences what Mercedes-Benz describes as Mood Changing Technology: the ENERGIZING comfort control. A system that adapts the temperature, fragrance, lighting mood, seats, music and many other components to the driver’s wishes  and improves the mood. At the touch of a button, the lion’s bad mood vanishes. He’s relaxing. An entertaining drive through the night begins, at the end of which he arrives home in a good mood. The stress is passé.

The film follows the reorientation of Mercedes-Benz towards human-centered innovation and focuses on human needs, albeit in an unusual way. As the technological flagship brand and industry leader, the S-Class takes on a pioneering role.

Mercedes-Benz: Vans & Drones | The Future of Transport
More and more people tend to order goods online: To make sure customers will get their purchases right on time or even faster, Mercedes-Benz, US drone systems developer Matternet and Swiss online marketplace Siroop initiated the joint project “Vans and Drones”. By combining Mercedes-Benz Vans as mobile landing platforms and drones as deliverer, it can be possible to achieve an order within only one day. This unique concept is being tested in Zurich to detect its efficiency and acceptance by customers. Heart of the concept is to mainly avoid traffic jams during the delivery process – the drone flies the product to the van that eventually supplies the order on the last mile.

Continuation of an excellent partnership: Mercedes-Benz is an Automotive Sponsor of the 2018 Mille Miglia - In the coming year, Mercedes-Benz will continue its commitment as an Automotive Sponsor of the Mille Miglia.  The close connection between the 1000-mile race in Italy and Mercedes-Benz dates back almost 90 years. The brand's great successes include a victory in 1931 by Rudolf Caracciola as the first non-Italian driver, and the sensational success of Stirling Moss in 1955, with an overall victory and a still unbeaten record time of 10 hours, 7 minutes and 48 seconds.  Mercedes-Benz will be present at the starting and finishing line in Brescia, and also along the approx. 1600-kilometre route to Rome and back.

Mercedes-Benz Energy Storage Home
With Mercedes-Benz Energy Storage Home (https://www.mercedes-benz-energy.com), everybody can use the energy he produces with an on-site solar system. People can save excess energy every day and use it even when the sun isn’t shining. This is how everybody can benefit from consuming the energy they produce, not to mention how everybody will profit from a reduction in the energy costs. The Mercedes-Benz Energy Storage Home is available in Germany, Benelux and UK. Joyful Anticipation: The pinnacle of anticipation (Rastatt plant)
The big finish – the pinnacle of anticipation: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Joyful Anticipation", private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Don’t miss any episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_c...

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the Finishing section, the final quality tests are carried out before the vehicle leaves the plant and is handed over to the customer polished to a high gloss.

“Joyful Anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, E-Class, S-Class, CLA, CLS, GLA, GLC, SL and SLC.

Mercedes-Benz presents: Highlights of the MercedesTrophy World Final 2017
The MercedesTrophy World Final is the climax of our own amateur golf tournament series, bringing together the qualified players from 60 countries all over the globe for a once-in-a-lifetime experience in Stuttgart, Germany, the home of the automobile. The 32 teams enjoyed spectacular golf at the courses of Schloss Nippenburg and Stuttgarter Golf-Club Solitude, an extensive visit from Mercedes-Benz brand ambassador Bernhard Langer and an exclusive supporting programme throughout the event.

Mercedes-AMG stands for high-performance vehicles made in Germany. Half a century of passion for performance and sportiness: From 20 October 2017 to 8 April 2018, the Mercedes-Benz Museum is holding the special exhibition 50 Years of AMG. The main attractions are ten vehicles, engines and other exhibits charting the history of the performance and sports car brand founded in 1967, among them the design model of the Mercedes-AMG Project ONE. On 21/22 October 2017, the accompanying programme includes public DTM talks and the presentation of numerous privately owned vehicles around the Museum at "AMG & Friends".

The engine was a compact 1493 cc 90-degree V8 with four overhead camshafts and 32 valves, its valve gear and arrangement being almost identical with the Grand Prix engine's. Its 254 hp (187 kW) at 8250 rpm were equivalent to a power-to-swept-volume ratio of 170 hp (125 kW) - indeed an impressive value. Mercedes-Benz at the Laver Cup 2017: Highlights
Rivals become team-mates. Maximum performance is key. Tennis unrivaled. The Laver Cup 2017: http://mb4.me/Laver-Cup-2017. Team Europe won the inaugural Laver Cup 2017, taking place in Prague from 22 to 24 September. Both Team Europe and Team World, each comprised of six players, brought some of the very best tennis to the Czech capital. Only three years ago, Roger Federer had the idea for the Laver Cup. Now it has become a thrilling reality. Mercedes-Benz supports this new tournament format as a proud Global Sponsor.

On 28 September 1977 the world’s toughest rally was won by two Mercedes-Benz upper mid-range saloons. Andrew Cowan and his team took first place in the Singapore Airlines London–Sydney Rally driving a 280 E (W 123) – now a sought-after modern classic – and Anthony (Tony) Fowkes and his crew came in second, also in a 280 E.

With new and considerably extended driving assistance functions, the new Mercedes-Benz S-Class will this autumn be taking a further, major step towards autonomous driving. Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC and Active Steering Assist now support the driver even more conveniently in keeping a safe distance and steering, and the vehicle speed is now also automatically adjusted in bends and at road junctions.

Mercedes-Benz: S-Class – Operating and Display Concept
The Operating and Display Concept of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class includes a user-focused system for operating the onboard computer and multimedia system. The media display is divided into different areas which are responsible for various elements. Mercedes-Benz: S-Class – Wireless charging and NFC setup
NFC (near-field communication) in the Mercedes-Benz S-Class allows wireless data exchange over short distances and thus makes it easier to set up the smartphone in the vehicle. Mercedes-Benz: E-Class Coupé – Multifunctional Touchpad
The multifunctional touchpad in the Mercedes-Benz E-Class Coupé is a haptic operating element which allows the command system to be comfortably controlled using the fingertips. It registers when fingertips touch the surface of the touchpad and also recognizes various control gestures. Three buttons permit fast access to all functions. Mercedes-Benz: E-Class Coupé – PRE-SAFE® Sound and PRE-SAFE® Plus
In certain situations, PRE-SAFE® Sound and PRE-SAFE® Plus for the Mercedes-Benz E-Class Coupé take preemptive measures to protect the vehicle occupants. PRE-SAFE® Plus is able to intervene by warning following vehicles visually if a rear end collision is imminent. PRE-SAFE® Sound can activate a natural protective mechanism by playing a short noise signal. Mercedes-AMG: Milestones – Episode 5: 2006
Mercedes-AMG stands for high-performance vehicles made in Germany. Founded in 1967 in Großaspach as AMG, the company has ever since gained great success in developing some of the best motorsport vehicles in the world. In 2006, Mercedes-AMG brand ambassador Bernd Schneider won his fifth Championship title – a unique record, which is still unbroken.

Joyful Anticipation: From bare sheet metal to the perfect coat of paint (Rastatt plant)
Absolute brilliance – from unpainted sheet metal to the perfect coat of paint: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, “Joyful Anticipation”, private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Don’t miss an episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the second part of the film series, it’s all about colour. From the plunge pool for the primer and the application of paint using the ultra-modern spraying robot to the paint finish when the final polish is carried out.

“Joyful Anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, E-Class, S-Class as well as CLA, CLS, GLA, GLC, SL and SLC.

Mercedes-Benz US Plant in Tuscaloosa: Celebrating the Past – Electrifying the Future: Twenty years ago the first SUV rolled off the line in the Mercedes-Benz plant (Mercedes-Benz U.S. International – MBUSI) in Tuscaloosa, Alabama. This success story is going to be continued as Mercedes-Benz plans to invest $1 billion in the expansion of the manufacturing footprint in the region. The announcement was made by Markus Schäfer, production chief of Mercedes-Benz Cars, at a press conference and enthusiastically received by 3,500 team members during the anniversary celebration. Most of the investment is slated for the production of full electric SUV models under the EQ subbrand as well as for a battery plant. The investment will help to create more than 600 new jobs in the region:

Mercedes-Benz US Plant in Tuscaloosa: Celebrating the Past – Electrifying the Future
Twenty years ago the first SUV rolled off the line in the Mercedes-Benz plant (Mercedes-Benz U.S. International – MBUSI) in Tuscaloosa, Alabama. This success story is going to be continued: Mercedes-Benz plans to invest $1 billion in the expansion of the manufacturing footprint in the region. The announcement was made by Markus Schäfer, production chief of Mercedes-Benz Cars, at a press conference and enthusiastically received by 3,500 team members during the anniversary celebration. Most of the investment is slated for the production of full electric SUV models under the EQ subbrand as well as for a battery plant. The investment creates more than 600 new jobs in the region.

The Mercedes-Benz X-Class meets the Laver Cup
The new Mercedes-Benz X-Class is the Official Trophy Car of the first ever Laver Cup – a never before played Tennis tournament including 12 of the best players in the world. Follow the X-Class and the brand new Laver Cup trophy on an epic journey through Prague and experience the excitement leading up to the tournament. From the Old Town Square right up to the court – the Golden City witnessed something truly unique: The new Mercedes-Benz X-Class meeting the Laver Cup. First of a new kind. Live von der Internationalen Automobil Ausstellung (IAA) in Frankfurt – Future Talk mit Olivier Reppert, CEO der car2go Group: Der Durchbruch des Carsharings: Wachstums- und Zukunftsprognosen sowie eine genauere Betrachtung der Sharing-Philospohie.

► Die Wachstumsaussichten und Zukunftsprognosen zum Thema Carsharing.
► Die gesamte Sharing-Philosophie: Was sind die Gründe, warum Menschen rund um dieWelt immer mehr Sharen und die gesamte Sharing-Industrie so wächst

Play Your Own Game: Mercedes-Benz at the Laver Cup 2017
Mercedes-AMG G 63: Fuel consumption combined: 13.8 l/100 km; combined CO₂ emissions: 322 g/km.* Rivals become team-mates. Maximum performance is key. Tennis unrivaled.

Roger Federer had the idea for the Laver Cup three years ago. Now the time has come: From 22 to 24 September 2017, the inaugural team contest will be held in Prague. Team Europe will compete against Team World. Both teams, each comprised of six players, will bring some of the best tennis players of our time to the Czech capital. Mercedes-Benz supports this new tournament format as a Global Sponsor.

Mercedes-AMG Project ONE: The Beauty and the Beast - The design of the Project ONE embodies the Mercedes-AMG principle that fascination is always linked with function. Every part has a specific purpose. The result is a mid-engine concept, extremely muscular proportions with the cockpit well forward, large wheel arches, a wasp waist and an extended rear end. 

“The Mercedes-AMG Project ONE is the hottest and coolest car we have ever designed. It combines our design philosophy of Sensual Purity with the performance of our Formula 1 racing cars and is the perfect embodiment of Performance Luxury,” says Gorden Wagener, Chief Design Officer Daimler AG: http://mb4.me/Beast_IAA

Intelligent World Drive in the Mercedes-Benz S-Class | 60 Seconds
Christoph von Hugo, Head of Active Safety at Daimler AG, explains the idea of the Intelligent World Drive, an automated test drive on five continents which was launched in Frankfurt (Main) at the IAA 2017. More infos about the Mercedes-Benz S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. With Intelligent World Drive, Mercedes-Benz wants to lay the foundation to design automated systems in different parts of the world, which will help customers in many situations. 

Until January 2018, this Mercedes-Benz S‑Class, which has been automated for test purposes, will face a variety of complex traffic situations. In the process, it will gather valuable experience on the road to autonomous driving. After the launch in Germany, the next test drive in the course of the Intelligent World Drive will take place in China followed by others in Australia in November and South Africa in December. The final stop of the tour will be the CES in Las Vegas in January.

Future Talk with Geoff Willis, Technology Director of Mercedes-AMG Petronas Motorsport
Join us live from the International Motorshow (IAA) 2017 for a Future Talk with Geoff Willis, Technology Director of Mercedes-AMG Petronas Motorspor: The Digitalization of Formula 1
The talk revolves around the extreme requirements concerning drivetrain technology, body shell and chassis for the success in Formula 1, which can be an important for the development of series production vehicles.

The live stream starts at 11:30 AM CEST on September 20, 2017. #MBIAA17  
More about Mercedes-Benz at the IAA 2017: http://mb4.me/2017-IAA

me Convention 2017 Day 1: Opening in Frankfurt with Buzz Aldrin
Astronaut Buzz Aldrin held the keynote for the opening of the first me Convention on Friday 15 September, in Frankfurt, Germany. The me Convention is a new event offered by Mercedes-Benz in cooperation with South by Southwest® (SXSW®). The event features a wide range of future topics including: New Creation, New Urbanity, New Leadership, New Realities, New Velocity. The me Convention is an inspiring mixture of workshops, expert round tables, interactive labs and art installations. More than 100 international visionaries, lateral thinkers and inspiring personalities from different social and cultural backgrounds will be present as speakers.

Project CARS 2 – Learn to drive on a frozen lake virtually: Experience Mercedes-Benz Driving Events in a video game for the first time - Mercedes-Benz Driving Events can now be experienced in a video game for the first time. The new Project CARSTM 2 racing game enables players to demonstrate their skills on the official Driving Events winter training course in Sorsele in northern Sweden on PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. This special training area, which actually lies on a frozen lake, is now replicated in every detail in Project CARS 2, so players can experience the challenges of the real tracks also virtually. The racing game was developed by globally operating Slightly Mad Studios and is being published, marketed and distributed by BANDAI NAMCO Entertainment Group. Project CARS 2 will be released on the 22nd September 2017 for PlayStation 4 system, Xbox One, and PC: https://lnkd.in/eH4CX2r
assigned_tags: driving events, lifestyle, product-placement, c-class coupé, Driving Events

Joyful Anticipation: From raw material to car body shell (Rastatt plant)
The first step – From the raw material to the body shell. Don’t miss an episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV. With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, “Joyful Anticipation“, private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time.  

In the first part of the video series, along with the aluminium foundry and the steel foundry, the press shop, as well as the body shell of the Mercedes-Benz Compact Cars can be seen in the production plant in Rastatt.

”Joyful anticipation“ is currently available for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, E-Class, S-Class as well as CLA, CLS, GLA, GLC, SL and SLC.

The new Mercedes-Benz S 560 e - More power, more range: The latest addition to the S?Class family is a new-generation plug-in hybrid. The S 560 e has an all-electric range of around 50 kilometres. In conjunction with the Mercedes-Benz Wallbox, the on-board 7.2?kW charger allows fast charging of the battery. Plug-in hybrids represent a key technology on the road to a locally emission-free future for the motor car. Live von der Internationalen Automobil Ausstellung (IAA) in Frankfurt – Future Talk mit Christoph von Hugo, Leiter Aktive Sicherheit und Ratings.
Autonomes Fahren ist eines der entscheidenden Themen für die Autoindustrie. Die Anfänge sind durch Assistenzsysteme schon gemacht.

Der Livestream begint am 18. September 11:30 Uhr. #MBIAA17

Mercedes-AMG: Milestones – Episode 4: 1998
Mercedes-AMG stands for high-performance vehicles made in Germany. Founded in 1967 in Großaspach as AMG, the company has ever since gained great success in developing some of the best motorsport vehicles in the world. In 1998, the evolutionary CLK LM with a V8 engine was introduced. It dominated the GT World Championship against likewise further developed competitors.

Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-AMG Compact Cars: Andrew Myers and the CLA Shooting Brake
Three vehicles in the Mercedes-AMG NGCC series, three different characters that nevertheless pursue the same ideals: they disrupt the expectations of their respective environments. A compact car with more than 350 hp? A coupé estate with racing genes? Apparent contradictions that disrupt wisdom and convention, freeing up the space for something new. Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube and don't miss an episode: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

That’s the way our testimonials in this campaign live, too.
Their motto: Life without performance? Unthinkable.

In this video, artist, painter and sculptor Andrew Myers talks about his art and goes for a ride in a Mercedes-AMG CLA.

Intelligent World Drive – five continents in five months: On the road to autonomous driving: Mercedes-Benz on automated worldwide test drive - With the "Intelligent World Drive", Mercedes-Benz is testing automated driving functions on all five continents using a vehicle based on the S?Class. At the International Motor Show (IAA) in Frankfurt, Dr. Dieter Zetsche, President and CEO of Daimler AG and Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, fired the starting gun to send the test vehicle off on its worldwide test drive. The test vehicle is based on the new series production saloon. Between now and January 2018, this S?Class, which has been automated for test purposes, will face a variety of complex traffic situations. In the process, it will gather valuable experience on the road to autonomous driving: http://mb4.me/s_drive

Mercedes-Benz to become first automotive manufacturer to use innovative address system: The world in three words - A new coordinate system organises the world, what3words, founded in 2013, assigns three words to every point on Earth, making locations easily and unambiguously identifiable – even where there are no addresses. Mercedes-Benz will be the first automotive manufacturer to use the new address system. How it is used for navigation purposes can be experienced live at the Mercedes-Benz stand (///demnächst.entdeckt.wort or ///bricks.sending.able) in Hall 2, Level 1 at the IAA in Frankfurt.

Concept EQA | 60 Seconds
Explore the design of the Concept EQA in 60 Seconds - with Gorden Wagener, Chief Design Officer and Robert Lesnik, Director Exterior Design. http://mb4.me/EQ_design

The Concept EQA is the first all-electric EQ concept vehicle from Mercedes-Benz within the compact segment. With significantly reduced seams and lines as well as the black panel at the front, which serves as a virtual grille, the vehicle is a further example of the systematic further development of the design language of sensual clarity. Its innovative lighting technology is based on laser fibres. The spiral light insignia stands for electric thinking and is visually evocative of the copper windings on an electric motor. content:
me Convention Talks: Buzz Aldrin // Urban Stage
LIVE at me Convention: Buzz Aldrin – Living Legend on #NewRealities
Meet the living legend Buzz Aldrin! Let’s hear about a future in space and #NewRealities at me Convention from him.

IAA 2017: Mercedes-Benz Cars in the Fast Lane
Innovative power packs, breathtaking luxury cars and the first hypercar with a Formula 1 power plant – at the International Auto Show (IAA) 2017 in Frankfurt Mercedes-Benz demonstrates that the future of mobility has already become reality. This video shows the highlights: e-mobility for the compact segment with the Concept EQA, the new S-Class models Plug-in hybrid, Convertible and Coupé and the first Pickup in the premium segment: the X-Class. The ultimative eye catcher is the Mercedes-AMG Project ONE: Formula 1 technology street ready and developed together with Formula 1 pilot Lewis Hamilton.
