Mercedes-Benz Cars at the Frankfurt International Motor Show (IAA): Mobility rethought – from Formula 1 hybrid drive to fuel cell technology: Mercedes-Benz Cars is shaping the mobility of the future – with courage, creativity and with exceptional solutions for diverse needs. The inventor of the automobile demonstrated this at the Frankfurt International Motor Show (IAA) with world premieres of four concept vehicles. The show car Mercedes-AMG Project ONE with Formula 1 hybrid technology stands for the “Future of Driving Performance”. The smart vision EQ fortwo presents an electric and autonomous solution for highly efficient and flexible local traffic. The Concept EQA is the first all-electric EQ concept vehicle from Mercedes-Benz in the compact segment. With pre-production models of the Mercedes-Benz GLC F-CELL, the brand with the three-pointed star is showcasing an electric vehicle with fuel-cell and battery drive for the first-time ever. With these electrified vehicles the company provides a preview of the future electrification of the entire lineup by 2022: http://mb4.me/IAA_2

Understanding the situation more quickly can save lives: Digital rescue assistants from Mercedes-Benz help emergency rescue crews directly at the scene – the latest update of the Rescue Assist App is available now and contains even more helpful information: http://rk.mb-qr.com

Sapere più rapidamente dove e come agire può davvero salvare vite: gli assistenti di soccorso digitali di Mercedes-Benz aiutano le squadre di soccorso durante gli interventi di emergenza direttamente in loco – ora anche con l'aggiornamento nuovo di zecca della Rescue Assist App e ancora più informazioni essenziali su: http://rk.mb-qr.com

IAA 2017 Future Talk [German Only] mit Anke Kleinschmitt: Forschung und Nachaltigkeit
Live von der Internationalen Automobil Ausstellung (IAA) in Frankfurt – Future Talk mit Anke Kleinschmitt. Nachhaltigkeit ist elementarer Bestandteil der Entwicklung von neuen Produkten und Technologien. Am Beispiel des Forschungsfahrzeugs F105 wird die in unterschiedlichen Facetten verdeutlicht.

Der Livestream begint am 14. September 11:30 Uhr. #MBIAA17
Mehr zu Mercedes-Benz auf der IAA: http://mb4.me/2017-IAA

IAA 2017: An Outlook on the complete electrification at Mercedes-Benz
Three world premieres at the 2017 International Auto Show (IAA) in Frankfurt, Germany, give an outlook on the continuing electrification at Mercedes-Benz. At the center of the presentation is the fully electric Concept EQA, the first of this new brand in the compact segment. 

A fuel cell plug-in hybrid vehicle will also make its first ever appearance at the event. The Mercedes-Benz GLC F-CELL EQ Power combines practical advantages such as a long range and short hydrogen fuelling times with locally emission-free driving. 

With the new, electrically powered smart vision EQ fortwo, the brand is exhibiting a study by the recently founded product and technology brand EQ as a world premiere. This fully autonomously driving concept car is the first model to comprehensively embody all four pillars of the corporate strategy CASE: ”Connected“, ”Autonomous“, ”Shared“ and ”Electric“.

Mercedes-Benz Concept EQA show car: EQ concept in the compact class - The Mercedes-Benz Concept EQA demonstrates how the EQ strategy can be introduced to the compact class. Featuring one electric motor at the front axle and one at the rear, the electric athlete has a system output of over 200 kW. The drive characteristics can be altered by varying the permanent all-wheel drive's front to rear torque distribution. The Concept EQA shows which program has been selected on a unique virtual radiator grille. See the new EQA on display at the IAA and read more about this electric athlete here: http://mb4.me/EQ_a

World première of the Mercedes-AMG Project ONE show car: Mercedes-AMG brings Formula 1 technology to the road - Ever since the early days of motorsport, engineers have dreamed of bringing motor racing technology to the road. Mercedes-AMG is now making this dream a reality at the very highest level: http://mb4.me/P1_IAA

"Motorsport is not an end in itself for us. Faced with intense competition, we develop technologies from which our production vehicles also subsequently benefit. We are drawing on our experiences and successes from three constructors' and drivers' world championships to bring Formula 1 technology to the road for the first time: in Mercedes-AMG Project ONE", says Dr Dieter Zetsche, Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG and Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars.

GLC F-CELL goes into preproduction: Electric vehicle with fuel cell and battery
At this year’s IAA International Motor Show in Frankfurt, Mercedes-Benz is presenting preproduction models of the new Mercedes-Benz GLC F-CELL as the next milestone on the road to emission-free motoring. Under the  technology designation EQ Power, the latest electric model (destined for subsequent series production) from the Mercedes-Benz family is doubly electrifying, for, as a world first, it is set to combine innovative fuel-cell and battery technology in the form of a plug-in hybrid: in addition to hydrogen, the all-electric variant of the popular SUV will also run on electricity.

Mercedes-AMG: Milestones – Episode 3: 1992
Mercedes-AMG stands for high-performance vehicles made in Germany. Founded in 1967 in Großaspach as AMG, the company has ever since gained great success in developing some of the best motorsport vehicles in the world. In 1992, Klaus Ludwig became DTM Champion in a Mercedes-AMG 190 E 2.5-16 Evolution II. Furthermore, Ellen Lohr was the first woman who ever won a DTM race. She competed in Youngtimer Trophy in an Evo II.

Joyful Anticipation for Mercedes-Benz customers – With Production chief Markus Schäfer
With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, “Joyful Anticipation”, private purchasers of new vehicles in Germany gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. Markus Schäfer, Member of the Divisional Board of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Manufacturing and Supply Chain, explains how digital transformation as initiative in our production strategy supports to create new services and real added value for our customers. With the digitisation of our production the prerequisite for this innovative digital service has been made and which will be expanded.

“Joyful Anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class. Shortly "Joyful Anticipation" will also become available in Germany for models from the Mercedes-Benz plant in Bremen (C-Class Sedan, Estate, Coupé, Cabriolet; E-Class Coupé and Cabriolet, GLC, GLC Coupé, SL, SLC).

IRONMAN World Champion Sebastian Kienle and the Mercedes-Benz V-Class: Winning in Mind
Triathlete Sebastian Kienle knows how it feels to be the first to cross the finish line of the Hawaiian IRONMAN. In 2014, the Mercedes-Benz ambassador won the triathlon world champion title in Kona. However, for the last two years, one competitor was faster than the 33-year-old Sebastian Kienle: Jan Frodeno. Now Kienle, who recently won the IRONMAN European Championship for the third time, has set a goal: to recapture the world championship title in Hawaii.

Mercedes-AMG Compact Cars: Eva Shaw and the CLA
Three vehicles in the Mercedes-AMG NGCC series, three different characters that nevertheless pursue the same ideals: they disrupt the expectations of their respective environments. A compact car with more than 350 hp? A coupé estate with racing genes? Apparent contradictions that disrupt wisdom and convention, freeing up the space for something new. Highlight of AMG’s 50-year Anniversary: Mercedes-AMG Project ONE Headed to IAA - The Mercedes-AMG Project ONE is loaded for transport to the International Automobil Ausstellung (IAA) in Frankfurt. The presentation of the show car at the Mercedes-Benz Media Night on the eve of the IAA is the highlight of AMG’s 50-year anniversary. The Mercedes-AMG Project ONE is the most ambitious project the performance and sports car brand has ever planned. The hybrid engine from Formula 1 and the electrified front axle provide a fascinating combination of performance and efficiency.

Mercedes-Benz eMobility and the E 350 e
[Fuel consumption combined: 2.5–2.1 l/100 km; combined CO₂ emissions: 57–49 g/km; power consumption weighted: 14.0–11.5 kWh/100 km.*] In this video we learn more about the new Mercedes-Benz E 350 e plug-in hybrid sedan in the context of the bigger picture of future eMobility. Mercedes-Benz invented the car more than 130 years ago introducing individual mobility to society. “I think it's our responsibility to move into a more sustainable, environmental friendly driving system,” Jochen Hermann, Head of Development CASE and Development eDrive, states. In those succinct, bold statements he summarizes the motivation behind the brand's new focus on connected, autonomous, shared and electric vehicles. Those words comprise the acronym CASE which is a new organization within Mercedes-Benz that is focused on the future.

assigned_tags: innovation, Connected CH, Autonomous CH, Shared/Services CH, Electric CH

content:
To shape the #FutureOfMobility you have to define it. We call this CASE – Intuitive Mobility - "Connected, Autonomous, Shared, Electric: Each of these has the power to turn our entire industry upside down. But the true revolution is in combining them in a comprehensive, seamless package.”

- Dr. Dieter Zetsche - Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG
#selfdrivingcars #electriccars #EV #Daimler

She's Mercedes – Official Trailer
She’s Mercedes is an initiative dedicated to inspiring, connecting and empowering women who are driven to make things happen. The power of inspiration can create great things. She’s Mercedes is the embodiment of this idea. An inspiration circle: a place for women to connect, share ideas and experiences and learn from each other. A destination for inspiring conversations, offering new perspectives and supporting ambitions. With She's Mercedes, we want to inspire, connect and enable women to realize their full potential.

Mercedes-Benz travels to the Frankfurt Motor Show with a new August sales record- Mercedes-Benz sold more cars worldwide than ever before in the month of August. Altogether, 170,341 automobiles with the three-pointed star were handed over to customers (+9.0%). In the first eight months of this year, 1,496,406 units have been sold, which is an increase of 12.8% when compared to the same period from last year. In August, Mercedes-Benz was the premium brand with the most new registrations in several markets including Germany, Spain, France, Switzerland, Portugal, Japan, Australia, Taiwan, Canada and Brazil.

“We are travelling to the Frankfurt Motor Show not only with new cars, but also with a new sales record from this August. We have achieved new best numbers every month for the past four and a half years,” stated Britta Seeger, Member of the Board of Management of Daimler AG responsible for Mercedes-Benz Cars Marketing & Sales. “We are proud to complete the extensive revision of our S-Class family with the world premiere of the new S-Class Coupé and the S-Class Cabriolet at the Frankfurt Motor Show.”

The new Mercedes-AMG S 63 4MATIC+ Coupé and Cabriolet and S 65 Coupé and Cabriolet: New dream Performance vehicles with Panamericana radiator grille - Mercedes-AMG is updating its S-Class Coupés and Cabriolets with a host of technical and visual highlights. The new-design front end is dominated by the Panamericana radiator grille, which now gives the two-door, luxury-class Performance vehicles an even more independent look. 

"Having already undertaken major development work on our S-Class Saloon to further enhance driving performance and individuality, we are now making the same changes to the S 63 4MATIC+ Coupé and Cabriolet. The extensive modifications are designed to strengthen our leading position in this dream car segment in terms of driving dynamics, performance, equipment and comfort on long journeys. The S 65 Coupé and Cabriolet with their high-torque 6.0-litre V12 biturbo engine remain the most elite form of the S-Class," stated Tobias Moers, CEO of Mercedes-AMG GmbH.

In 1988, AMG formed a partnership with Mercedes-Benz which resulted in numerous race wins. Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Brake Assist with cross-traffic function
The Active Brake Assist in the Mercedes-Benz S-Class's ride assistance package protects the driver in case of imminent danger of collision during cross-traffic of up to 70 km/h. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Parking Assist with rear cross traffic alert
The Rear Cross Traffic Alert, in conjunction with Blind Spot Assist, can warn drivers of parking in front of traffic jams and automatically brake it in an emergency. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Remote Parking Assist – Exploration mode – Getting out of parking spaces
The Remote Parking Assist for the Mercedes-Benz S-Class makes it possible to enter and leave the car via the smartphone. This simplifies entry and exit. Up to 15 metres, the vehicle can be manoeuvred forward or backward via the smartphone. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Remote Parking Assist  – Getting out of narrow parking spaces
The Remote Parking Assist makes it possible to park in narrow parking areas using the smartphone. In the Exploration mode, the driver can simply activate his vehicle via the smartphone to take it out. Up to 15 metres it can be manoeuvred forward and backward. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Remote Parking Assist – Getting into narrow parking spaces
The Mercedes-Benz S-Class Remote Park Assist helps getting into narrow parking spaces. As soon as the vehicle has detected a free parking space, the corresponding function can be activated from outside via the smartphone. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: PRE-SAFE® PLUS
PRE-SAFE® PLUS warns drivers and occupants of collisions in follow-up traffic as well as the corresponding effects. By means of radar sensors in the rear bumper, dangerous situations such as an approaching car can be detected. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Car-to-X Communication
The Car-to-X Communication of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class extends the horizons of the vehicle sensor system by exchanging information with other vehicles. The mobile radio-assisted technology can be used to warn against threats. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Evasive Steering Assist
The Evasive Steering Assist helps, among other things, to straighten the vehicle after an evasive manoeuvre. The dodge steering assistant then helps, among other things, when the vehicle is being steered straight. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Steering Assist
The Active Steering Assist of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class helps drivers to control the vehicle by helping to keep the vehicle in the middle of the lane. If the Active Steering Assist recognizes lane markings, the vehicle remains automatically on track at a maximum speed of 210 km/h even in slight bends. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Brake Assist with pedestrian detection
The Active Brake Assist of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class warns inattentive drivers, among other things, in the event of a dangerous collision hazard with vehicles or crossing pedestrians. If the driver doesn’t apply the brakes enough, the brake pressure is increased. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Brake Assist with congestion emergency braking function
The Active Brake Assist offers a practical stowing emergency braking function in the Mercedes-Benz S-Class driving assistance package. If the vehicle does not travel faster than 130 km/h, the system can respond early and automatically brake. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Lane Keeping Assist
The Active Lane Keeping Assist warns against unintentional lane departure with a vibration of the handlebar and actively intervenes in case of potential danger. The active Lane Keeping Assist detects, in the speed range between 60 and 200 km/h, when lane markers are crossed, and tries to counter-steer. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Lane Change Assist
The Mercedes-Benz S-Class Active Lane Change Assist supports lane changing on multi-lane roads at a speed of 80 to 180 km/h. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Blind Spot Assist
The Blind Spot Assist of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class warns against lateral collisions with other vehicles when changing the lane. As soon as the sensors register vehicles in the blind spot, a warning sign appears in the outside mirror. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Emergency Stop Assist
The Active Emergency Stop Assist of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class is able to decelerate the vehicle in the case of an emergency in its own lane up to a standstill if the driver is permanently not taking control. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Subscribe to the Mercedes-Benz YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC – Route based speed adustment
The Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class can adapt the driving speed in many situations such as before sharp curves or the entry into a roundabout. In doing so, he reverts to map and navigation data. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Mercedes-Benz S-Class 2017: Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC – Extended automatic re-start
The Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class relieves the driver of the distance and speed control. This includes, among other things, that the driver is automatically supported during traffic jams or columns when starting. Read more about the new S-Class: http://mb4.me/S-Class-Facelift. The Active Speed Limit Assist of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class recognizes, among other things, tempolimits and automatically adjusts the vehicle speed to the specified speed. Mercedes-Benz X-Class: Pickup Meets Lifestyle – Trailer #2.
The Mercedes-Benz X-Class unites the typical traits of a pickup – robustness, functionality, strength and off-road capabilities – with the classical characteristics of a real Mercedes-Benz: design, comfort, driving dynamics and safety. The Mercedes-Benz X-Class will be available in three variants: The PURE basic variant for classic robust use, PROGRESSIVE for higher requirements in terms of quality feel and comfort, and POWER as the high-end variant for urban lifestyles.

More information on: www.mercedes-benz.com/x-class

The AMG 300 SEL 6.8: On the Road to the Future of Driving Performance
The AMG 300 SEL 6.8 – that’s how it all began. Way too heavy for a race car but so powerful it still won the 24h of Spa. In 50 years we’ve never stopped challenging. The Future of Driving Performance is about to begin.

Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-AMG: Milestones – Episode 1: 1971
Mercedes-AMG stands for high-performance vehicles made in Germany. Founded in 1967 in Großaspach as AMG, the company has ever since gained great success in developing some of the best motorsport vehicles in the world. The first milestone was the 24-hour race of Spa-Francorchamps in 1971 with the victory and second place in the overall rating of the Mercedes-AMG 300 SEL 6.8. Digital Anticipation: Mercedes-Benz Plant Sindelfingen – Paint Shop.
Absolute brilliance – from unpainted sheet metal to the perfect paint finish: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, “Digital Anticipation”, private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Don’t miss any episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the second part of the film series, it’s all about colour. From the plunge pool for the primer and the application of paint using the ultra modern spraying robot to the paint finish when the final polish is carried out.

“Digital anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz:
http://benz.me/international/

A true highlight. 
Thanks to fibre-optic cables and LED technology, the central star emblem in your Mercedes' radiator grille lights up when you remotely lock/unlock the vehicle or open the door or tailgate. A LED projector projects the Mercedes star to the ground and comfortably guides you the way when entering and leaving the vehicle: http://mb4.me/Star

Su estrella guía personal. 30 years ago: Front-passenger airbags from Mercedes-Benz - Vehicle safety at Mercedes-Benz is an issue that is relevant not only to the driver of a vehicle, but also to their passengers. It was for this very reason that the Stuttgart-based brand launched the front-passenger airbag in September of 1987. It was a further important innovation in vehicle safety, following the driver's airbag that had first been introduced in March of 1981. Beginning in 1988, the front-passenger airbag became available in the S-Class, as well as in the 124 series, a precursor of today's E-Class. As early as 1994, it became a standard feature in numerous Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

Future Needs Heritage | Episode 2: Steer and let steer.
Soon after the invention of the automobile by Carl Benz and Gottlieb Daimler, the steering wheel revolutionised the operation of the motor car. Until today, it is an important man-machine interface in vehicles. Read more about the history of the steering wheel: http://mb4.me/steering-wheel. Don’t miss the next episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Mercedes-Benz G-Class: Epic road trip through Canada and Alaska
A group of outdoor photographers – the German Roamers – took two Mercedes-Benz G-Class on a 3,000 kilometer journey from Whitehorse, Canada, all the way to Anchorage, Alaska: http://mb4.me/G-Class-North-America. The ultimate road trip led Hannes Becker, Lennart Pagel and Johannes Höhn through the rough North American vastness. Filmmaker Mathias von Gostomski accompanied the group on and off the rugged highways, where they explored and documented the extreme environments in their very own creative style – with the assistance of the Mercedes-Benz G-Class. 

Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

#createthenew with James Ardinast at me Convention – a collaboration between Mercedes-Benz and SXSW.
Nobody knows Frankfurt’s nightlife like restaurateur James Ardinast, so Mercedes-Benz and SXSW joined forces with James to #createthenew for the me Convention. The me Convention takes place at Festhalle Frankfurt (Main) and in the Bahnhofsviertel between 15–17 September 2017. Check out our international line-up and more information about the me Convention 2017 at: http://mb4.me/me-convention.

The very first me Convention is a collaboration between Mercedes-Benz and SXSW. Technology, business and art experts come together to enable those who want to make a difference and #createthenew.

Mercedes-Benz Cars at the 2017 International Motor Show (IAA): Exciting new models and innovative event formats from the inventor of the automobile - Mercedes-Benz is reinforcing its ambition to help shape the mobility of tomorrow at the Frankfurt International Motor Show (IAA), 14 - 24 September 2017. The Mercedes-AMG Project ONE hypercar with Formula 1 hybrid drive technology points the way to AMG's "Future of Driving Performance".  A new smart showcar shows an intelligent solution for shared urban mobility. Further outlooks on the full electrification of the portfolio are provided by a concept car in the compact car segment and the GLC F?CELL EQ Power, a pre-series model with fuel cell hybrid drive. Also celebrating their world première at the show are the comprehensively updated S-Class Coupé and S?Class Cabriolet in both the standard and AMG versions, as well as the new X?Class, the first-ever pick-up by Mercedes-Benz.
assigned_tags: passenger-cars, AMG, trade show, mercedes-amg x1

Digital Anticipation: Mercedes-Benz Plant Sindelfingen – Body Shell.
The first step – from the raw material to the body shell: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, “Digital Anticipation”, private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Don’t miss any episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the first part of the video series, along with the aluminium foundry and the steel foundry, the engine plant and press shop, as well as the body shell of the Mercedes-Benz E-Class and S-Class can be seen in the production plant in Sindelfingen.

“Digital anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz:
http://benz.me/international/

360° at the Mercedes-Benz Museum – Legend #7 (Silver Arrows) - Part Two.
For the first time ever, we now let you explore the Mercedes-Benz Museum with 360° views. Grab your smartphone and enjoy the ride! More information: http://mb4.me/mercedes-benz-museum. Don't miss the next episode and subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

The Mercedes-Benz Museum is the only museum in the world that can document in a single continuous timeline the more than 130 years of auto industry history from its very beginnings to the present day. As a place of innovation, it also demonstrates that history can point the way ahead.

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/

Thanks to growth of 14.3%, a total of 934,965 cars with the three-pointed star were delivered to customers all over the world since the beginning of the year. This means that compared with the first five months of last year, over 100,000 more customers decided in favour of a Mercedes-Benz.

Future Needs Heritage | Episode 1: Bertha’s great adventure.
In 1886, Carl Benz invented the automobile. Two years later, his wife Bertha Benz took on the first long-distance trip. It was a trip of around 100 kilometres, characterised by strong confidence in the Patent Motor Car. The trip became the departure point of the future of mobility. Read more about Bertha Benz’ adventure: http://mb4.me/berthas-adventure. Success story made in Bremen: Sales milestone at Mercedes-Benz as the GLC passes one million mark - Since its market launch in 2008, the sales figure of the successful GLC and its predecessor GLK has now surpassed more than one million vehicles sold. The GLC recorded higher sales in recent years than any other SUV from Mercedes-Benz. In addition, more units of the GLC were sold in the first half of 2017 than ever before in the same timeframe. The model is produced at the Mercedes-Benz plant in Bremen and shipped globally, where it is especially popular in China.

“Grow up” is a film series from Mercedes-Benz about rewriting the rules of life established by previous generations. In this documentary, we take a behind-the-scenes look at the production in Barcelona, while further examining the new realities faced by the next generation of adults. It was 25 years ago that Mercedes-Benz taught the world of motor sport a very special lesson in evolution theory. The AMG-Mercedes 190 E 2.5-16 Evolution II racing tourer dominated the 1992 season of the German Touring Car Championship (DTM): from a total of 24 races, Mercedes-Benz drivers brought home 16 victories, 17 second places and 13 third places.

It was 25 years ago that Mercedes-Benz taught the world of motor sport a very special lesson in evolution theory. The AMG-Mercedes 190 E 2.5-16 Evolution II racing tourer dominated the 1992 season of the German Touring Car Championship (DTM) with a whopping 16 wins from 24 races.

300 SL Roadster and Mercedes-Simplex 40 PS in Pebble Beach: Automotive stars under the Californian sun - Mercedes-Benz Classic is taking two automotive gems to California. A factory-restored 300 SL Roadster from 1957 will compete in the renowned Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance on 20 August 2017. As an accompaniment to the Concours, a Mercedes-Simplex 40 PS, manufactured in 1903, will also be on display. This outstanding vehicle is synonymous with the birth of the modern automobile. As part of the Monterey Car Week, it will likely also take part in the Pebble Beach Tour d'Elegance on the peninsula between Monterey and Carmel-by-the-Sea on 17 August 2017.

She’s Mercedes: ADAY – The future of clothing.
Minimalist cuts, high-quality fabrics, sustainable design and – very importantly – comfort. The ADAY fashion label designs women’s clothes for uncomplicated, everyday use – be it in the office or the late-night party. We spoke to the founders at their studio in New York’s SoHo district to find out what’s behind their design philosophy and followed them around the city in a CLS 500 Coupé. The art of simple living: http://forward.mercedes-benz.com/shes-mercedes-aday

Find out more about ADAY: https://www.thisisaday.com

Ongoing innovation in the interests of safety: 50 years ago - All Mercedes-Benz passenger cars were equipped with safety steering including impact absorber - The quest for increased safety for driver, passengers and all other road users is a key theme in the brand history of Mercedes-Benz. This vision has always been realised in an ongoing process of safety development. The result is a host of innovations that set standards for the entire automotive industry.  With the goal of vehicle safety becoming ever more complex, since the 1960s engineers and researchers have made a distinction between active safety (driving safety, physiological safety and operational safety) and passive safety (interior and exterior safety). Today, the focus is on holistic solutions for integrated vehicle safety that combine various systems. With Intelligent Drive, Mercedes-Benz offers its customers assistance and safety systems that guarantee maximum safety, comfort and driver stress reduction.

Classic Days Schloss Dyck 2017: Automobile classics by a famous moated castle - This coming weekend, August 5 - 7, Schloss Dyck in the Rhineland, with its extensive parks, will be a major attraction for fans of classic automobiles.  An inimitable sound will once again be heard: the roar of the legendary, supercharged Mercedes-Benz SS and SSK sports cars. Both will take to the circuit as "racing legends" on the estate of this moated castle. Further entertainment will be ensured by the presence of several Mercedes-Benz brand ambassadors: Jutta Benz, Roland Asch, Klaus Ludwig, Jochen Mass, Bernd Mayländer and Karl Wendlinger will all be attending the Classic Days Schloss Dyck 2017.

In 1989 Max Bill created this tripartite sculpture with a hight of 32 m as a commissioned work for the then Daimler-Benz AG. The sculpture's ground plan relates to the Mercedes star. It remained Bill's the most important public sculpture and is valued as a landmark sculpture in Southwest Germany still today. The color sequence follows structural and mathematical rules. 

Max Bill (1908–1994), one of the leading European artists of the 20th century, parallely worked as product and graphic designer.

More about the Daimler Art Collection: http://d.ai/DaimlerArtCollection

Let your car park itself! Daimler and Bosch have teamed up to realise driverless parking (Automated Valet Parking) in the multi-storey car park at the Mercedes-Benz Museum in Stuttgart. Cars now proceed without a driver to their assigned parking space in response to a command issued by smartphone, without any need for the driver to supervise the manoeuvre. Automated valet parking marks an important milestone on the way to autonomous driving: http://mb4.me/Asx4AlqL

Mercedes-Benz presents AVP: Bosch and Daimler realised Automated Valet Parking.
Bosch and Daimler have teamed up to realise driverless parking (Automated Valet Parking) in the multi-storey car park at the Mercedes-Benz Museum in Stuttgart: http://mb4.me/Mercedes-Benz_AVP. Cars now proceed without a driver to their assigned parking space in response to a command issued by smartphone, without any need for the driver to supervise the manoeuvre. Automated valet parking marks an important milestone on the way to autonomous driving. The pilot solution at the multi-storey car park of the Mercedes-Benz Museum represents the world’s first infrastructure-supported solution for an automated drive-up and parking service in real-life dual operating mode. From the beginning of 2018, visitors to the museum’s multi-storey car park will be able to experience the convenient service at first hand and avoid spending time parking their cars.

Production record for the Mercedes-Benz G-Class off-road icon: 300,000th G-Class rolls off production line in Graz - The 300,000th vehicle of the legendary G-Class has rolled off the production line at Magna Steyr in Graz, 200 km in the south of the Austrian capital Vienna. The record-setting vehicle is a Mercedes-Benz G500 in the colour designo mauritius blue metallic, with black leather seats and contrasting white stitching.  Sales of the G-Class have grown continually since 2009. Thanks to the strong growth rates, the forefather of the SUV, the G-Class, achieved a new sales record in 2016 with almost 20,000 units being sold within a year. In fact, the G-Class has achieved a new sales record every year since 2012.

Mercedes-Benz Classic at Solitude Revival 2017 in Stuttgart: At the fifth Solitude Revival, Mercedes-Benz Classic will bring the great age of motorsport back to life on the legendary Stuttgart circuit. The Solitude Ring is the home track of Mercedes-Benz and lies at the very heart of the brand's racing history. Among the vehicles on show will be the Mercedes-Benz Model S from 1927 and the AMG 300 SEL 6.8 from 1971, which was based on a Mercedes-Benz luxury-class saloon. The drivers in attendance will be Dieter Glemser, Hans Herrmann, Jochen Mass and Jan Seyffarth. The Solitude Revival starts on Friday - 21 July and runs through Sunday - 23 July.

me Convention is a collaboration between Mercedes-Benz and SXSW. It will take place September 15-17th at the Festhalle in Frankfurt, Germany.

Join us for three days of expert talks, inspiring keynotes, workshops, interactive labs, and art installations, and a special program of evening events that will be held throughout the historic city center!

Web: www.me-convention.com
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Meconvention
Instagram: www.instagram.com/meconvention/

Morgan Catalina (@meconvention producer) explains the essence of me Convention: new creation, new leadership, new realities, new urbanism, new velocity. 
The future dialogue is a collaboration between Mercedes-Benz and @SXSW. me Convention takes place in at Festhalle Frankfurt, September 15-17, 2017.

Mercedes-Benz X-Class: Pickup Meets Lifestyle – Trailer.
The Mercedes-Benz X-Class unites the typical traits of a pickup – robustness, functionality, strength and off-road capabilities – with the classical characteristics of a real Mercedes-Benz: design, comfort, driving dynamics and safety. The Mercedes-Benz X-Class will be available in three variants: The PURE basic variant for classic robust use, PROGRESSIVE for higher requirements in terms of quality feel and comfort, and POWER as the high-end variant for urban lifestyles.

More information on:

Mercedes-Benz presents His First Open.
Mercedes-Benz brand ambassadors Bernhard Langer (Germany) and Li Haotong (China) talk about...

Mercedes-Benz GLC 350 e Coupé 4MATIC:
Fuel consumption combined: 2.7-2.5 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 64-59 g/km;
power consumption weighted: 15,2–13,9 kWh/100 km.* 

...playing The Open, the world's oldest major in professional golf, for the very first time. Langer remembers 1976, Li is looking forward to 2017. The two stories connect at Royal Birkdale Golf Club, England.

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz:
http://benz.me/international/.

Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube:
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

Product may vary after press date on 18.07.2017.

* The figures are provided in accordance with the German regulation “PKW-EnVKV” and apply to the German market only. Further information on official fuel consumption figures and the official specific CO₂ emissions of new passenger cars can be found in the EU guide “Information on the fuel consumption, CO₂ emissions and energy consumption of new cars”, which is available free of charge at all sales dealerships, from DAT Deutsche Automobil Treuhand GmbH and at www.dat.de.

Mercedes-Benz X-Class: All Highlights in 60 seconds.
With the new Mercedes-Benz X-Class we are pushing the boundaries of the classic pickup. It is uniquely versatile in terms of its area of application – it can be used as a rugged, all-terrain pickup but also as a vehicle for urban lifestyles and families. The Mercedes-Benz X-Class complements the prized strengths of a mid-size pickup with the typical Mercedes-Benz characteristics of driving  dynamics, comfort, design, safety, connectivity and an extensive scope for individualisation. The X-Class is the Mercedes-Benz among the pickups.

More information on: 
http://mb4.me/new-x-class

http://benz.me/international/

http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV

World Premiere of the Mercedes-Benz X-Class in Cape Town.
Join the world premiere of the Mercedes-Benz X-Class in Cape Town! Livestream starts on Tuesday, July 18 at 7.14 p.m. CEST / 5.14 p.m. GMT.

Last year Mercedes-Benz presented the X-Class concept cars in Sweden; now the series model is in the starting blocks. The new X-Class enriches the familiar strengths of a pickup by adding typical Mercedes-Benz characteristics, thus uniting apparent contradictions: extreme robustness and a progressive design, impressive off-road capabilities and great driving dynamics on the road as well as exemplary functionality and stylish comfort. #XClass #XtraClass

More information soon on: http://mb4.me/new-x-class

Mercedes-Benz C-Class Cabriolet | A tour around Lake Garda | #MBvideocar.
Mercedes-Benz presents the first episode of the #MBvideocar series. In this episode the Mercedes-AMG C 43 4MATIC Cabriolet proofs to be a perfect choice to explore the beauty of Lake Garda. German filmmaker Marian Hofmann and Claudio Grande made their way along the famous road SP 38, where James Bond: Quantum of Solace has been filmed. Cruising topless next to crystal clear water or roaring through the many tunnels along the streets. A road trip showing all facets of the car and the well known Lake Garda – between breathtaking views, sunshine and good times!

Mercedes-AMG C 43 4MATIC Cabriolet:
Fuel consumption combined: 8.4–8.3 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 194–190 g/km.*

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/.

Subscribe to Mercedes-Benz on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=MercedesBenzTV.

Product may vary after press date on 11.07.2017.

* The figures are provided in accordance with the German regulation “PKW-EnVKV” and apply to the German market only. Further information on official fuel consumption figures and the official specific CO₂ emissions of new passenger cars can be found in the EU guide “Information on the fuel consumption, CO₂ emissions and energy consumption of new cars”, which is available free of charge at all sales dealerships, from DAT Deutsche Automobil Treuhand GmbH and at www.dat.de.

Driverless journey of the Mercedes-Benz S-Class from production line – Mercedes-Benz original
Mercedes-Benz is entering a new dimension of motoring with its new S-Class and is raising the bar, in terms of production, for the automotive industry worldwide. 

For the official start-up of the luxury saloon in the Mercedes-Benz plant Sindelfingen, the S-Class drove independently off the final assembly line, without a driver at the wheel. The vehicle then drove automatically approximately 1.5 kilometers to the loading area within the plant. The Sindelfingen plant is currently piloting the possible use of the system for series production and investigating its further potential. The start of production for the new and fundamentally updated S-Class brings the introduction of state-of-the-art manufacturing processes and cutting-edge Industry 4.0 solutions in the assembly area. 

Close integration with sophisticated IT systems and communication technology results in the optimization of the flow of materials, further improved flexibility an efficiency, and enhanced ergonomics for the workforce. 

Mercedes-AMG S 63 4MATIC+:
Fuel consumption combined: 8.9 l/100 km; 
combined CO₂ emissions: 203 g/km.*

S 560 4MATIC: 
Fuel consumption combined: 8.5 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 195 g/km.*

Tickets are now available for the first edition of the me Convention, which will be held September 15 - 17 in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. The me Convention is a collaboration between Mercedes Benz and SXSW, bringing together experts from many different fields - creative, design, tech & more - for a critical dialogue about the future.  The me Convention will include three days of expert talks, inspiring keynotes, workshops, interactive labs, art installations, as well as a special program of evening events that will be held throughout the beautiful, historic city center of Frankfurt. For more information about the event and to purchase tickets, please visit: http://me-convention.com

Mercedes-Benz posts strongest half-year ever with sales of more than 1.1 million cars - In the first six months of 2017, Mercedes-Benz was more successful than ever before. 209,309 cars were delivered to customers in June (+11.1%) and 1,144,274 in the first six months of the year (+13.7%). The Stuttgart-based company with the three-pointed star has set new sales records, significantly surpassing its prior-year unit sales both in June and in the first six months of the year. In addition, the second quarter was the best-ever quarter with 583,649 vehicles delivered worldwide (+11.6%).

Between 1995 and 1998, Robert Longo developed a series of large-format artworks after an inquiry by Daimler Art Collection. One of them was 'Big Red Car', an airbrush painting showing the Mercedes-Benz SLK from the side. The roadster, presented in 1997, appears magnified and floating; the illusion of a plastic depiction of the car is deconstructed though by the partition of the painting into 100 single parts.

More about the Daimler Art Collection: http://d.ai/DaimlerArtCollection

Between 1995 and 1998, Robert Longo developed a series of large-format artworks after an inquiry by Daimler Art Collection. One of them was 'Big Red Car', an airbrush painting showing the Mercedes-Benz SLK from the side. The roadster, presented in 1997, appears magnified and floating; the illusion of a plastic depiction of the car is deconstructed though by the partition of the painting into 100 single parts.SLK

Mercedes-Benz Classic at Silvretta Classic Rally Montafon 2017: "White Elephant" and coupé classics on idyllic roads - At the 20th Silvretta Classic Rally Montafon, Mercedes-Benz Classic will be highlighting a Mercedes-Benz dating back to 1928 plus four coupés. The SSK exemplifies the Kompressor sports cars S to SSK nine decades ago, while the coupés (model series W 114 and C 124) honour what could be the most elegant interpretation of automotive sportiness. The coupés will be driven by Brand Ambassadors Klaus Ludwig and Karl Wendlinger and the Rally is taking place July 6-9, 2017.

Start of production at the Mercedes-Benz plant in Sindelfingen: Driverless journey of the S-Class from production line to loading area - Mercedes-Benz has entered a new dimension with its S-Class and is raising the bar, in terms of production, for the entire automotive industry worldwide.  A Mercedes-Benz S 560 4MATIC drove independently off the final assembly line, without a driver at the wheel, approximately 1.5 kilometres to the loading area within the plant. Newly developed and patented technology works in conjunction with cameras, radar, ultrasonic sensors and powerful software to accelerate and brake the S-Class independently, ensuring that it always stays safely and reliably on track.

Buďte vždy informovaní o najnovšom uloženom statuse vozidla, ako je napríklad stav palivovej nádrže, odčítanie merača prejdenej vzdialenosti, doba parkovania a oveľa viac. Zistite, ako získať zariadenie Mercedes me Adapter: http://mb4.me/AdapterSK31

La posizione della tua auto verrà memorizzata automaticamente al termine del viaggio, facilitandone la localizzazione in qualsiasi momento. Come? Grazie a Mercedes me Adapter. Scopri come richiederlo: http://mb4.me/AdapterIT31�

Disponibile per la tua Classe A del 2004 o più recente.

A Mercedes me Adapter a 2005 óta gyártott legtöbb Mercedes-Benz A-osztály számára rendelkezésre áll. Segítségével mindig naprakész lehet járműve legutóbb tárolt állapotáról, mint például az üzemanyagszintről, a kilométeróra állásáról, a parkolási időről és még sok másról. Így vásárolhatja meg az Adaptert: http://mb4.me/AdapterHU31

Fås til de fleste Mercedes-Benz A-klasse-biler fra 2005 og tidligere: Mercedes me Adapter. Hold dig ajour med den seneste gemte bilstatus som f.eks. brændstofniveau, kilometertæller, parkeringstid og meget mere. Find ud af, hvordan du får din adapter: http://mb4.me/AdapterDK31

Disponível para a maioria dos veículos Mercedes-Benz Classe A a partir de 2005 e mais recentes: o Mercedes me Adapter. Manter-se sempre a par do estado do veículo memorizado por último, como o nível do depósito, a quilometragem, a duração do estacionamento e muito mais. Descubra aqui como pode obter o seu Adapter: http://mb4.me/AdapterPT31

Saatavissa useimpiin Mercedes Benzin A-sarjan malleihin vuodesta 2005 lähtien: Mercedes me Adapter. Ole aina selvillä viimeksi tallentuneesta ajoneuvon tilasta, kuten polttoaineen määrästä, kilometrilukemasta, pysäköintiajasta ja monesta muusta tapahtumasta. Katso tästä, kuinka voit saada Adapterin: http://mb4.me/AdapterFI31

Fås for de fleste Mercedes-Benz-biler i A-klassen fra 2005 og senere: Mercedes me adapteren. Hold deg alltid løpende oppdater om den siste lagrede statusen for bilen, som tanknivå, kilometerteller, parkeringstid og mye mer. Her finner du ut hvordan du får tak i adapteren: http://mb4.me/AdapterNO31

Tillgänglig för de flesta bilarna i Mercedes-Benz A-klass fr.o.m. 2005 och framåt. Mercedes me-adaptern: Håll dig alltid uppdaterad om bilens senast sparade status för bränsletanksnivå, vägmätare, parkeringstid och mycket mer. Ta reda på hur du skaffar din adapter här: http://mb4.me/AdapterSE31

Erhältlich für die meisten Mercedes-Benz A-Klasse Fahrzeuge ab 2005 und jünger: der Mercedes me Adapter. Immer auf dem Laufenden bleiben über den zuletzt gespeicherten Fahrzeugstatus wie Ihr Tankfüllstand, Kilometerzähler, Parkzeit und vieles mehr. Mercedes-Benz Classic at the Arlberg Classic Car Rally 2017: Classic cars at alpine heights - Mercedes-Benz is once again the automobile partner of the Arlberg Classic Car Rally, happening this weekend - June 29th to July 2nd, 2017. The event features more than 100 classic cars built between 1917 and 1975. Mercedes-Benz Classic will have 2 vehicles from its ALL TIME STARS line-up appearing, a 1971 Mercedes-Benz 280 SE 3.5 and a 1974 350 SLC. The Arlberg Classic Car Rally offers spectators a chance to view fascinating cars set against the impressive panoramic backdrop of the Alps.

Mercedes-AMG – 50 Years of Driving Performance – Mercedes-Benz original
Half a century of driving performance – Mercedes-AMG is celebrating its 50th anniversary this year! Over the course of this half-century, Mercedes-AMG has repeatedly demonstrated its position as a highly successful sports car and performance brand by means of numerous successes in motorsport and the development of unique road vehicles. By extending the AMG GT family of sports cars with the new Mercedes-AMG GT C, the brand is again demonstrating its innovative power. The new vehicle will launch in the form of a special Edition 50 model and is identifiable by its broad, muscular rear end and large wheels. #AMG50Years

Mercedes-AMG GT C:
Fuel consumption combined: 11.4 l/100 km;
combined CO₂ emissions: 259 g/km.*

Further information on official fuel consumption figures and the official specific CO₂ emissions of new passenger cars can be found in the EU guide “Information on the fuel consumption, CO₂ emissions and energy consumption of new cars”, which is available free of charge at all sales dealerships, from DAT Deutsche Automobil Treuhand GmbH and at www.dat.de.

World premiere of the new coach Tourismo RHD – Mercedes-Benz original
World premiere for the new high-deck touring coach from Mercedes-Benz. The brief was: maximum cost effectiveness, safety, functionality and comfort. The outcome is the new Tourismo RHD – a touring coach with features that impress companies, passengers and drivers alike. A significantly extended range of appointment variants and engines means that the new Tourismo RHD lends itself to an extraordinarily wide spectrum of applications. Its field of activity includes long-distance regular-service routes and long-distance touring through to shuttle services, excursion travel and occasional use on inter-city routes. All of which add up to identify the new Tourismo RHD as the new star in the business segment, which is how Mercedes-Benz defines this multi-faceted area of the bus and coach sector. The new Tourismo RHD is set to supersede Europe's best-selling high-deck touring coach after eleven years. Series production of the Tourismo RHD starts in July of this year, with all models on stream by the end of 2017.

Concept EQ - Mobility revisited: At the Paris Motor Show, Mercedes-Benz unveiled its new product brand for electric mobility: EQ. The name EQ stands for “Electric Intelligence” and is derived from the Mercedes-Benz brand values of “Emotion and Intelligence”. The new brand encompasses all key aspects for customer-focused electric mobility and extends beyond the vehicle itself. This is Drive to the Major – Mercedes-Benz original
With the “Drive to the Major” competition, Mercedes-Benz combines the international MercedesTrophy premium amateur tournament series with professional golf at The Open and offers golfers the chance to be part of this fantastic experience. The “Drive to the Major” participants will have the chance to qualify for the Monday After Event played directly after The Open on the same course where the world’s best golfers have played for the Claret Jug the day before. The competition is the single entry point worldwide to win a spot in this “money can’t buy” event. A worldwide USP for Mercedes-Benz! More about Mercedes-Benz Golf: http://mb4.me/golf-overview

A Guide to Growing Up - Mercedes-Benz Deutschland has developed a national social media campaign for the five compact car models A-Class, B-Class, CLA Coupé, CLA Shooting Brake and GLA. On 23 May 2017, elbkind started an influencer campaign in which the topic of “growing up” is illustrated authentically on the Internet using real stories and personalities – and by using a completely new format. With a combination of a scripted background story and unscripted interviews, Mercedes-Benz is breaking with the convention of a typical influencer marketing strategy. The result is social content which is both authentic and high quality in terms of dramatization: http://mb4.me/RCHLnfEW

Mercedes-Benz increased its unit sales by a double-digit rate once again in May, selling 193,741 vehicles worldwide (+13.5%). Thanks to growth of 14.3%, a total of 934,965 cars with the three-pointed star were delivered to customers all over the world since the beginning of the year. Compared with the first five months of last year, over 100,000 more customers decided in favour of a Mercedes-Benz.  During the month of May, the Stuttgart-based company with the star was the premium brand with the most new registrations in the European markets of Germany and Switzerland, as well as in the markets of Japan, Australia, Taiwan, Canada, Mexico and the USA.

Our intelligent energy storage solutions enable home-owners and businesses with solar energy systems to maximise their utilisation of the electricity they have generated themselves. Resulting in a dramatic reduction in their energy costs. 

The market for electric cars is picking up speed, too. This means there is also increased demand for storage systems and charging stations. 

Our energy storage solutions are a huge market for the future – from which you can benefit right now as a Mercedes-Benz Energy Expert.

Half a century of Driving Performance: Celebrating 50 years of Mercedes-AMG success. These three letters - AMG - stand worldwide for supreme automotive performance, exclusivity, efficiency and high driving dynamics. The company, founded by Hans-Werner Aufrecht and Erhard Melcher in 1967, is celebrating its 50th anniversary in 2017. Over the course of this half century, Mercedes-AMG has further consolidated its position as an extremely successful sports car and performance brand with numerous successes in motorsport and the development of many unique vehicles. Today, as a wholly owned subsidiary of Daimler AG, the Affalterbach-based company represents the sporting spearhead of the Group.

A group of outdoor photographers – the German Roamers – took two Mercedes-Benz G-Class on a 3,000 kilometer journey from Whitehorse, Canada, all the way to Anchorage, Alaska. 

The ultimate road trip led Hannes Becker, Lennart Pagel and Johannes Höhn through the rough North American vastness. Filmmaker Mathias von Gostomski accompanied the group on and off the rugged highways, where they explored and documented the extreme environments in their very own creative style – with the assistance of the Mercedes-Benz G-Class.

A quick warmup for the 300,000th G-Class before the big road trip. We want to celebrate with as many G-Class fans as possible so we are taking our "birthday boy" all around Europe on the #Gventure300k. First trip: Stuttgart -> Berlin. Keep your eyes open over at Mercedes-Benz G-Class!

#FoodForThought

This trip was a lot about driving – we spent a fair share of our time in those two #G550 s and never grew tired of it. They truly are the perfect travel companions. We just love the iconic, rough look of the vehicle and yet we are surprised time and time again when we get behind the wheel. Hidden under the solid design of this car is so much technology and a dynamic driving capability you wouldn’t expect at first glance.

Check our Instagram story to get even closer to the action! ?? ?? @pangea

#MBfacingthenorth #MercedesBenz #Mercedes #Benz #TheBestOrNothing #GClass #neverstopexploring #therearenolimits #offroad4x4 #G550 #G500 #roadtrip #Alaska #Denali #MBPhotoPass

___________________________ [Mercedes-Benz G 550 | Fuel consumption combined: 12.3 l/100 km |CO2 emissions combined: 289 g/km]

Unfortunately we had to return to Europe, even if we would have loved to stay longer. Both Canada and Alaska deeply impressed all of us with their beautiful nature and all of the friendly, funny, awesome people we met along the way. This goodbye also means saying farewell to our two #G550 travel buddies, so we thought we’d best say cheers by showing you our reliable workhorses in full glory. If you want to see more about the entire trip, check the bio to see the video of #MBfacingthenorth. So long, your @germanroamers.

A group of outdoor photographers – the German Roamers – took two Mercedes-Benz G-Class on a 3,000 kilometer journey from Whitehorse, Canada, all the way to Anchorage, Alaska.

The ultimate road trip led Hannes Becker, Lennart Pagel and Johannes Höhn through the rough North American vastness. Filmmaker Mathias von Gostomski accompanied the group on and off the rugged highways, where they explored and documented the extreme environments in their very own creative style – with the assistance of the Mercedes-Benz G-Class.

The first step – from the raw material to the body shell: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Digital Anticipation", private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the first part of the video series, along with the aluminium foundry and the steel foundry, the engine plant and press shop, as well as the body shell of the Mercedes-Benz E-Class and S-Class can be seen in the production plant Mercedes-Benz Sindelfingen.

"Digital anticipation" is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.

content: For Mercedes-AMG, 2017 is all about its 50th anniversary. The company, founded in 1967, has also put its brand presence at the Nürburgring 24-hour race under the motto ’50 Years of Driving Performance’. At the race track, a total of seven Mercedes-AMG GT3 will be taking on the challenge to beat the clock. The race cars from Affalterbach will have a strong driver line-up for the attempt to build on last year’s historic quadruple victory. Next to showcasing legendary race cars from every decade of its corporate history, the debut of the limited-edition model ‘Mercedes-AMG GT3 Edition 50’ is yet another highlight in the Mercedes-AMG activity programme.

Mercedes-Benz in April: 50th consecutive sales record - Mercedes-Benz achieved record unit sales for the 50th consecutive month in April. In the first month of the second quarter, 180,599 vehicles with the three-pointed star were delivered to customers, which is 10.1% more than in the same month of last year. Compared with the first four months of 2016, 14.5% more vehicles have been sold this year: a total of 741,224 units.

Perfection – from individual parts to the overall masterpiece: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Digital Anticipation", private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. 
Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In Assembly, the individual vehicle components are put together. The car is born. One of the many highlights is the so-called marriage: putting together the body shell and the drive train.

"Digital anticipation" is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.

With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Joyful Anticipation“, private purchasers of new vehicles in Germany gain access to an exclusive website when they order. 
Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 
Markus Schäfer, Member of the Divisional Board of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Manufacturing and Supply Chain, explains how digital transformation as initiative in our production strategy supports to create new services and real added value for our customers.

#MercedesBenz #Mercedes #Benz #DigitalTransformation #JoyfulAnticipation “Joyful Anticipation” is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.
Shortly "Joyful Anticipation" will also become available in Germany for models from the Mercedes-Benz plant in Bremen (C-Class Sedan, Estate, Coupé, Cabriolet; E-Class Coupé and Cabriolet, GLC, GLC Coupé, SL, SLC).

The worldwide sales success of Mercedes-Benz is based on outstanding design concepts. As the influential head of Daimler design, Gorden Wagener looms large. Wagener and his team have created a design philosophy of Sensual Purity, which is a central theme of all vehicles currently bearing the Three-pointed Star. This design philosophy has now been put to page, exhibiting “modern luxury” in book form.

A special highlight of the book is the “Mercedes-Benz Future World”. It offers a glimpse of how the designers’ dreams might take shape in the future; bold concepts and ideas today, yet realistic in the world of tomorrow: https://lnkd.in/gBgS95x

#WorldDesignDay #WDD2017

In this video we learn more about the new Mercedes-Benz E 350 e plug-in hybrid sedan in the context of the bigger picture of future eMobility. "Mercedes-Benz invented the car more than 130 years ago introducing individual mobility to society. I think it's our responsibility to move in to a more sustainable, environmental friendly driving system," Jochen Hermann, Head of Development CASE and Development eDrive, states. In those succinct, bold statements he summarizes the motivation behind the brand's new focus on connected, autonomous, shared and electric vehicles. The design of the Project ONE is very obviously inspired by the premium class in motorsport. But above all, it embodies the Mercedes-AMG principle that fascination is always linked with function. Every part has a specific purpose. The result is a mid-engine concept, extremely muscular proportions with the cockpit well forward, large wheel arches, a wasp waist and an extended rear end.

Big wave surfer Sebastian Steudtner is always on the run, chasing the ultimate wave: http://mb4.me/lssJiKty
His goal: breaking the world record for riding the biggest wave. Over the course of a year, photographer and filmmaker Alex Laurel accompanied Steudtner from the training units in Hamburg, Germany to the roaring waters of Nazaré, Portugal. The result pays tribute to the powerful force of the ocean’s waves, one that exerts a pull that can hardly be avoided, yet one that can never be conquered either.

Absolute brilliance – from unpainted sheet metal to the perfect coat of paint: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Joyful Anticipation", private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. 

Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the second part of the film series, it's all about color. From the plunge pool for the primer and the application of paint using the ultra modern spraying robot to the paint finish when the final polish is carried out.

"Joyful Anticipation" is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.

With the Concept A Sedan at Auto Shanghai Mercedes-Benz is providing an outlook of the next generation of compact vehicles. The Concept A Sedan show car specifies the evolved Mercedes-Benz design language. Thanks to its purist, surface-focused design featuring reduced lines and gaps, the show car is hot and cool at the same time. The "Aesthetics A" sculpture already demonstrated that the upcoming compact class generation marks the dawn of an even more rigorous implementation of the design idiom of "sensual purity".

The big finish – the pinnacle of anticipation: With the new digital service from Mercedes-Benz, "Joyful Anticipation", private purchasers of new vehicles gain access to an exclusive website when they order. 
Customers in Germany can immediately follow the production of their individually configured Mercedes-Benz passenger car in real-time. 

In the Finishing section, the final quality tests are carried out before the vehicle leaves the plant and is handed over to the customer polished to a high gloss.

"Joyful Anticipation" is currently only available in Germany for the following model series: A-Class, B-Class, CLA, GLA, E-Class, CLS, S-Class.

Join us live from the International Motorshow (IAA) 2017 for a Future Talk with Geoff Willis, Technology Director of Mercedes-AMG Petronas Motorsport.
The talk revolves around the extreme requirements concerning drivetrain technology, body shell and chassis for the success in Formula 1, which can be an important for the development of series production vehicles.

The live stream starts at 11:30 AM CEST on September 20, 2017. #MBIAA17

The DTM season is starting soon and fans have been given their first look at the Mercedes-AMG C 63 DTM car for the 2017 season. New technical regulations will see the car producing over 500bhp for the first time in DTM history, while changes to tyre design will lead to quicker degradation, placing greater demands on a driver. Drivers are anticipating an exciting and adrenaline fuelled year ahead, with the cars labelled ‘fun’ to drive. Get a first glance: http://mb4.me/rtBRQYlS

content: With new and considerably extended driving assistance functions, the new S?Class will this autumn be taking a further, major step towards autonomous driving. Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC and Active Steering Assist now support the driver even more conveniently in keeping a safe distance and steering, and the vehicle speed is now also automatically adjusted in bends and at road junctions. Also on board are Active Emergency Stop Assist and a considerably improved Active Lane Change Assist.

Sporty SUVs Debut at the New York Auto Show – Mercedes-Benz original
Mercedes-Benz unveiled a set of sporty mid-size SUVs, the AMG GLC 63 4MATIC+ SUV and Coupé, alongside the four-door GT Concept car, at the 2017 New York Auto Show.

Beach and peaks: on Crete with the V-Class and Dynafit – Mercedes-Benz original
Five women from Dynafit, an outdoor apparel manufacturer, travel to the island of Crete with their skis and in winter clothes. Their mission: to discover the contrasting worlds of the Greek island. In addition to beautiful beaches, fragrant olive groves and ancient sites, Crete also has largely undiscovered winter attractions. The V-Class transports the athletic women safely from place to place.

Mercedes-Benz Vans is overcoming boundaries: By initiating the Startup adVANce Challenge, the department of Future Transportation is searching for innovative partners around the world. The aim is to identify young businesses with whom to commonly develop intelligent solutions for the transportation of passengers and goods. Event reporter Markus Haubold was on site at the first meet up, where selected startups got in touch with Mercedes-Benz Vans and had the opportunity to present their ideas.

Originally built as a racing sports car, the Mercedes-Benz SL was designed for peak performance. However, customer demand prompted the developers of successor models to seek more refined ways to express athletic prowess. The SL combined increased power with innovations that kept on setting new benchmarks for comfort and safety. But the secret of its popularity was without doubt that the Mercedes-Benz SL wore its sporting ambition with an air of distinction and cultured refinement. It is a combination that has become the trademark of a living legend. Read more about the history of the Mercedes-Benz SL: http://mb4.me/JzRM3wDW

Adaptable, decisive, and always calm in stressful situations, these are just some of the characteristics that an auto electrician needs in the DTM. Thilo Jung likes his work. “It’s quite unique,” says the 27-year-old. “It’s very varied, and you get around a fair bit. Everything about the whole package is great too. It’s like one big happy family. You’re on the road with the guys all the time, and we sometimes go out together in the evenings.” Thilo does not find the pressure of a race weekend in any way problematic. “I take things as they come,” he says, calmly. Read more: http://mb4.me/Y6HR4lpP

The English painter and graphic artist David Hockney has been experimenting with cubist formal distortions and breaking pictures up in photomontages since about 1980. These include the steering wheel of a Mercedes-Benz that Hockney constructed from individual motifs: a whole set of detailed small-format shots taken from the driver’s point of view then collaged to form a new whole. The image suggests that the driver’s view is governed by central perspective, but in fact it represents a viewpoint that is as fragmentary as it is subjective, made up of various points of view.

More about the Daimler Art Collection: http://d.ai/DaimlerArtCollection

Mick Schumacher - a racing driver in driving school. He might be one of the talented pilots competing in the Formula 3 European Championship but there are no exceptions for him either – no driving test, no licence. In presumably the world’s fastest driving school, the plot involves five lessons on the way to getting a driving licence. Each episode has an adventure in store for #QuickMick – at the end stands the big question: How well will the 18-year old racing driver do in his test? Watch the second episode here:  http://mb4.me/QuickMick2

Peking to Paris: on the trail of life. The Peking-Paris rally is regarded as one of the most demanding classic car rally events. It has only taken place five times since 1907. With their 1958 model 219 "Ponton", Dirk and Alexandra demonstrated that even a classic Mercedes-Benz can handle any challenge. See for yourself: http://mb4.me/Wgtw9d0z

In 1986, Mercedes-AMG brought us the AMG 300 E 5.6, the fastest German series vehicle with a top speed of more than 303 km/h. American press outlets were so impressed by the vehicle that they coined the pseudonym "The Hammer". It's unlikely the legend of The Hammer will be outdone, but with the recent debut of the Mercedes-AMG E 63 S 4MATIC+, you might want to check back in 50 years. Mobile World Congress Barcelona #MBMWC17 – Mercedes-Benz original.
Four days of digitalization. 108,000 visitors and professionals from 208 countries. 2,300 participating companies – and we are in the middle of it!
 
Mercedes-Benz's showing at this year's Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, being held from 27 February to 2 March is all about CASE: "Connected", "Autonomous", "Shared & Service" and "Electric Drive". Under the umbrella of the cross-Daimler digitisation strategy, the inventor of the automobile is showcasing products, initiatives and the latest innovations from its research and development activities.

Daimler is driving digital transformation forward at the Mobile World Congress with too with DigitalLife@Daimler: besides the show stand with its wealth of innovations and products and the intriguing sessions at both the conference and the 4YFN startup event, the DigitalLife Café offers an open platform for collective dialogue. One of the real highlights at the MWC are the Live Talks with experts from various Daimler AG business units. Sascha Pallenberg, one of the very first tech bloggers, hosts the Inspiration Talks that will take place three times daily and focus on digital services, trends and the culture of innovation.

Dr. Dieter Zetsche at the SXSW 2017: The Future of Autonomous Driving – Mercedes-Benz original
Dr. Dieter Zetsche – Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG and Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars – was the first CEO of a DAX-listed company visiting the South by Southwest conference as a keynote speaker. In his well-attended lecture about the future of autonomous driving Zetsche emphasised the importance of map services. He is convinced that we primarily need highly accurate location information to unlock the potential of the automotive future we are all dreaming of.

“No E-Class has ever been as versatile as the All-Terrain”, says Ola Källenius, Member of the Daimler management board. Convince yourself and read all about the E-Class All-Terrain: http://mb4.me/all-terrain.

The new E-Class All-Terrain combines a striking look in SUV style and the intelligent space concept of the estate with lots of innovative safety features and the multi-award-winning E-Class interior. Tradition and future – from the Simplex to the S-Class.?Being a role model means leading the way. Since the earliest days of the automobile, the top-of-the-line models from Mercedes-Benz have been the most well-known and famous ambassadors of German automotive engineering. With groundbreaking innovations, they have set the standards for passenger car development in general. This tradition is still alive today and will, find its continuation in a model series that carries forward the prestigious name of the S-Class into the future. Today we celebrate the 183. birthday of Gottlieb Daimler and the progression of his groundbreaking invention. The output of the first version built in 1884 was around one horsepower at 600 rpm. With this unit, which was designed for low weight and compact dimensions, Daimler and Maybach created the basis for installation in a vehicle. The first experimental vehicle was a motorcycle with a wooden frame subsequently known as the Riding Cycle or Riding Car. Read more: http://mb4.me/FnPOvnTA

Mercedes-Benz in Austin: Why? - Mercedes-Benz original
A festival with cult character is taking place in Austin/Texas in March: Over ten days, it's the venue for film, music – and digitalization. content:
360° EQ VR Experience – Mercedes-Benz original
Immerse yourself in the world of EQ! EQ stands for intelligent electric mobility from Mercedes-Benz. For attractive design, exceptional driving pleasure, high everyday comfort and maximum safety. The new product brand represents "emotion and intelligence", two brand values of Mercedes-Benz. It covers all essential aspects for customer-oriented electromobility and goes beyond the vehicle. EQ offers a comprehensive electromobile ecosystem of products, services, technologies and innovations. Experience the electrified and connected mobility. Accompany the Concept EQ on its way.

Mercedes-AMG GT Concept – Driving Performance of the future – Mercedes-Benz original
As part of its 50th anniversary Mercedes-AMG is this year celebrating not only the successful past and present; above all it is looking forward. With the show car Mercedes-AMG GT Concept the sports car and performance brand is giving an indication of the alternative drive configurations AMG is designing. Over and above this the four-door coupé heralds the further extension of the AMG GT family. The third model series after the SLS AMG and AMG GT is now being completely autonomously developed at the company’s headquarters in Affalterbach. The designation and fundamental design elements on the front and tail end denote the family affiliation to the AMG GT. The "EQ Power+" identifier on the mirror cam indicates the increased performance that can be expected from hybridisation at AMG.

Experience the world of Mercedes-Benz: http://benz.me/international/
